She plans to spend the anticipated proceeds on purchasing an automobile so that she can transport the goods herself.

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for trade

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: From Kompong Chhnang province, Mrs. Eam T., age 55, and her husband, Chomroeun, age 30, earn their daily profit by farming a rice crop. In addition, the family also buys bamboo to make baskets to sell. Recently, Mrs. Eam T. gets a lot of orders from her valued customers to make a basket for them. However, she doesn't have enough raw materials to make the baskets. So, Mrs. Eam T. is looking for a loan to buy bamboo for basket-weaving. She proposes that she will use the rest of her funds to buy rice for the whole family to eat.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for basket-weaving. She proposes that she will use the rest of her funds to buy rice for eating for the whole family.

loans.name: Kabi

texts.en:
Kabi is a 41 year old married man, living in Metn with his wife and four kids. Kabi has worked in construction for 17 years. He's specialized in selling construction supplies such as sand and small stones necessary for building. 

Kabi  is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the secod time, in order to fix his pick-up, which is the most important tool he uses to transport the requested materials. His previous loan was helpful and he was a good paying back borrower. Kabi inherited this business from his father, and he hopes he can expand it and hand it on to his kids.

loans.use: To fix his pick up.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with 10 other family members. After gaining experience in the trading business, Mostafa opened his own food market in 2007. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Mostafa is requesting a $2400 loan to install shutters and put up a sign at the bakery entrance. Also, he wants to buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory. He is planning to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install shutters, put up a sign, buy a refrigerator and increase his inventory

loans.name: Kanybek's Group

texts.en:
Retailing of consumer goods has many advantages and disadvantages in local markets. Advantages are that it does not need a large start-up capital and there is always a high demand. While disadvantages are that most of these goods are perishable, therefore need fast sales. 

Kanybek A., 34, is a member of this group. He is single and lives with only person who is financially dependent on him,  a seven-year-old nephew. Kanybek really wants his nephew to grow to be an independent, educated person and he does his best to provide him with all the necessities. Therefore, 4 years ago, Kanybek made his first steps into the business sphere. He used 75,000 soms of his savings to start the wholesale of consumer goods in a market of his home-town, Kerben. He plans to spend a loan from Kiva on investing in goods circulation. He expects to earn 7,000 soms per month, which will be used to make the payments for this loan, to pay health-care related expenses and to take a better care of his nephew. The remaining portion will be put back into his business. Kanybek has fought so that he and his nephew won’t lack anything. He pledges to successfully repay the loan and dreams to open a chain of shops in future. 

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods for trade.

loans.name: Masimkan's Group

texts.en:
For everyone who is involved in changing lives of those who are in need, it is twice as pleasant to help somebody’s talent prosper and see the achieved results. Masimkan is one of those who developed her talent thanks to this loan.

Masimkan T., 54, is a leader of this group. She is divorced and lives with a young grandson. For last ten years she’s been doing a small business by offering sewing services. In the beginning she was offering just small services in repairing of clothes. Later she applied for her first loan from Kiva through its Kyrgyz partner, Mol Bulak Finance. It really helped her to promote her business and to realize her new ideas. She brought new innovations into her clothing industry. Step by step she transferred to designing national clothing and to set her level of qualification higher. Soon she tended to have permanent customers ordering new designs on a regular basis. 

With her second loan from Kiva, Masimkan plans to purchase new high-quality fabrics and to design new styles of outfits. Every month she gets income of 7,000 soms, which she spends on daily needs for herself and her grandson. A portion of her profit is reinvested back into the business and the rest is saved. Masimkan was very happy when she saved enough to purchase home electronics and to send her son to Russia to find a permanent job. For Masimkan, this is a second loan offered by Kiva, so she is sure she’ll do her best to repay the loan on time, according to the schedule.

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Busara's Group

texts.en:
Milk production is very successful in Kyrgyzstan. Such companies as Bishkek-Sut and Vimm Bil Dan provide the residents with high quality milk products. According to statistics an average person consumes milk products at least once a day.

Busara J., 47, is a leader of this group. She is married to a farmer and has a twelve-year-old daughter. She started her business of milk production in 2003 and hasn’t regretted it at all. First she purchased a dairy cow and sold the generated milk to friends from the neighborhood every morning. Busara's business became so popular in the neighborhood that she had to buy more dairy cows in order to generate more milk. Soon local ice-cream and cake producers started purchasing her milk on a regular basis. They liked high quality of this raw material. The next idea was to diversify her products. Busara bought new equipment for making high sorted cheese, sour cream and butter. She loved how everything worked out and sold all of her products almost immediately. The reason Busara applied for this loan is that she’s in need of new equipment for making milk products because her old one is getting exhausted. Busara’s dream is a two-storied big house where her daughter would be happy to live. 

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Join Hand Group

texts.en:
David K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. David was born in Rochen village, in northern Sierra Leone, forty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has three children who attend primary school. David has been a professional carpenter for six years. 

This is the first loan that David and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. David will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy boards and other carpentry equipment in order to improve his workshop.

loans.use: To buy boards and other carpentry equipment

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem K. is an older man who appears on the photo. He is skilled at building wooden houses and currently uses his knowledge to earn money. He has a few employees to help him. Koem K. has four children; three of them work in various jobs and one is still a student in the local school. Koem K. has a life partner in his wife who is a rattan cupboard maker. 

Koem K. is concerned because he faces difficulty in traveling to his work. He always travels by motor taxi because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Koem K. has requested a loan to be used to buy a new motorcycle. With the remaining cash, he will support his wife's business to buy wood for making beds.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and to support his wife's business

loans.name: Mougne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MOUGNE est créé en 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées par affinité et par  voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KOBITENE.

Madame Christine D. debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 48 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Mais elle a la charge de 06 enfants qui lui sont confiés par sa sœur
 
Elle s'active depuis dans la vent de poissons séchés au marché central de Ziguinchor, Et sa collaboration avec CAURIE-MF lui permet de renouveler ses prêts et de continuer ses activités.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge les enfants de sa sœur qui lui sont confiés
texts.en:
The Mougne solidarity group has been created in 2008 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois to which it belongs. It is composed of 11 women living in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to create a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kobitene.

Mrs. Christine Diehiou, standing to the right with her arm raised in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 48 years old. She is single without children. But she has six children in her care, entrusted to her by her sister. She has been selling dry fish at the main market of Ziguinchor. Her collaboration with Caurie-MF allows her to take out loans and grown her business. Her goal is to support herself and to provide for her sister’s children in her care.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling dry fish

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
In order to make a living, many residents of the Kyrgyz rural areas have chosen to live abroad, while others are trying to build a future for the country by uniting efforts and talents.

Gulmira N., 48, is the leader of this group. She is married and has a sixteen-year-old son. Since her childhood, she has been very close to animals. She used to take the cattle to the pastures high in the mountains and look after them until the sun set. However, Gulmira wouldn’t have a cattle business now if not for her husband’s friend, who suggested to them to start breeding and reselling cattle three years ago.

Gulmira and her husband have come from humble beginnings to impressive results. The cycle of buying and reselling cattle has generated a considerable income for the family. With 15,000 KGS of start-up capital, Gulmira improved her business to earn 4,000 KGS per month. Gulmira is planning to constantly improve her living conditions. She would like to use this loan to buy furnishings for the house. Gulmira is well aware of all conditions of repaying the loan and absolutely agrees to make the payments during the set time period. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a carpet

loans.name: Kakoma Twebeiseho Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: K. Mary, 59 years old, has been operating a general merchandise retail business in Kakoma-Bushenyi for the past 4 years. She says her set objective in starting this business was to establish a dependable source of income for herself and her family of five, her husband included. In her shop, she sells a variety of commodities popular with many village folk. Mary also has an up-and-coming banana sales business which she anticipates will grow provided she buys more manure for her banana gardens. This business generates Mary 100,000 UGX weekly. With this loan, she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as rice, beans, maize flour, bread, sugar, etc. to resell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Myrzamurat's Group

texts.en:
Challenging circumstances force many people to find a way to feed their families. Our next creditor is no exception. He has had to overcome many disappointments and struggles on his way to his current established business.

Myrzamurat M., 50, is a member of this group. He is married and the father of a seventeen-year-old daughter. His most important wish is to bring up a healthy and strong daughter, provide her with education and ensure her basic needs are met at home. For these reasons, Myrzamurat has been working hard on his business of livestock breeding and reselling for the past three years. With this loan, he will buy some more goats to raise and resell.

Myrzamurat is a young, ambitious and energetic businessman who is dedicated to his work and can do more if supported financially. He says his biggest challenge has been fluctuations of livestock prices in the market. His daughter helps him with the household when she’s not studying. Myrzamurat works hard to keep his business going and is known for his tolerance and consistency in dealings with clients. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Nazareen's Group

texts.en:
Nazareen, 34 years old, lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan, famous for its culture and history. She lives in a small home with her husband and five daughters in the area of Green town. She moved here after her marriage. Three of Nazareen's daughters are students and the others stay at home because they are too young to attend school. Nazareen's husband, M. A., is a butcher by profession. He has operated a meat selling shop in the community for the past 10 years. He specifically sells goat meat. Due to his agreeable manner and the quality of his meat, he has a good number of customers. Nazareen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has a part-time business selling clothes to clients in her community. She purchases clothes from the famous Anarkali market and the Azam cloth market in Lahore and earns a good profit. She does this work to help her husband financially.

Nazareen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some goats to help him fulfill his customers' orders and earn more profit. Nazareen is hopeful about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. Nazareen is new lender with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Hojiakbar's Group

texts.en:
For centuries, farming and cattle breeding have been major sources of survival in the rural areas of Kyrgyzstan. It hasn’t changed nowadays either. These two activities are the most profitable and wide-spread in rural areas.

Hojiakbar H., 27, is a resident of the small town of Kadamjai, in southern Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has a one-year-old child. Hojiakbar works in a local military committee and, in his free time, he breeds and resells cattle. Three years ago, his father gave Hojiakbar a young calf as a wedding gift , telling him that cattle has always been their family’s bread, their major source of income.

Following his father’s advice, Hojiakbar has promoted his business significantly in three years. His household now consists of one dairy cow with a calf and four heads of sheep and goats. Hojiakbar is very happy with the way his business is running. In the summer, it’s much easier to feed cattle. Hojiakbar usually takes them to pastures high in the mountains, where they get plenty of fresh food and water. In the winter, however, his expenses almost double since he has to purchase food and keep the livestock in a warm heated paddock. For this reason, Hojiakbar applied for this loan. He would like to buy at least 350 kg of food for his cattle and buy additional heads of cattle in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Manepeh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Manepeh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kassah K.. A native of Makeni, Kassah is married and has three children. Her husband is a baker and two of her children attend primary school. Kassah has been running a business selling bread and fish for fifteen years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more bread and fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread and fish

loans.name: Haider

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has six children. In 2008, H. opened his own food market because the competition in his area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

H. is requesting a $1500 loan to buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory

loans.name: Rokel Social Club Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Rokel Social Club” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Regina M. T.. Regina is twenty-eight years old. She was born in one of the villages that make up Yoni, in northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she lives in Magburaka, together with her husband and four children, who attend primary school. Regina sells firewood and cooked rice. With her share of this loan, Regina will buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, tomatoes, etc. - and firewood in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and firewood

loans.name: Jan Kloud

texts.en:
Jan Kloud is a 33-year-old married man, and the father of 3 children. He lives and works in Metn, where he has owned a bookstore for 8 years. He sells books, newspapers and stationary. Jan Kloud has a family to take care of so he must work hard to provide them with what they request.

Jan Kloud is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to add new products to his business. He wants to start selling toys, gifts and gadgets. Jan Kloud believes that being hardworking helps in secure living, and that everyone must add something new to their business to attract new clients. Jan Kloud is a good standing borrower; he is welcome at anytime to request a loan from Al Majmoua, as most of his clients speak highly about his good manners. He hopes to develop his business more by adding new products.

loans.use: to add new products to his business

loans.name: Najem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has three children. In 2005, Najem decided to open his own business as a blacksmith, since he had some experience. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Najem is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a big generator so his production won't stop when the electricity is down. He is aiming to grow bigger and increase his revenues.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Nayzak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with three family members. In 2007, Nayzak decided to open a barber shop, as he has good experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation.

Nayzak is requesting a $1200 loan to redecorate his shop, put up a sign at the entrance, and buy a small generator. He aims to grow his business in the future and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop, put up a sign at the entrance and buy a small generator

loans.name: Tataimitha Group

texts.en:
Fatmata T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makally village thirty-two years ago. She is married and has five children, three of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells rice, palm oil and ready-to-wear clothes. 

This is the first the loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business by buying rice and palm oil in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Mutoo Z.  est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe Faraja, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants.  Son conjoint est un comptable d’un établissement privée. Mutoo Z.  est vendeuse de friperie au petit marché sectoriel TMK.  Elle fait également le commerce des sacs à mains pour accroitre ses revenus. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari d’une valeur de 80$. Depuis 2000, elle exerce cette activité.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux articles (1 ballon de friperie et 1 ballon de sacs à mains).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et s’approvisionner dans les grands centres comme Dubaï. La cliente mutoo Z.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Faraja est constitué de 26 membres.
texts.en: Mutoo Z. is an entrepreneur and the secretary of the Faraja group. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of seven. Her spouse is an accountant in a private business. Mutoo Z. sells second-hand clothing at the local market in the TMK sector. She also sells handbags in order to increase her revenues. She had launched her business with her own starting capital in the amount of $80 received from her husband. She has been in this business since 2000. Later on she obtained a loan of $50,- from IMF Hekima. The new loan will allow her to stock up on goods (one sack of  second-hand clothing and one sack of handbags). In addition, her goal is to expand her business and to stock up in big cities such as Dubai. As a client of Hekima, Mutoo Z. is grateful for its work in support of the poor who are excluded from traditional banking. The Faraja group  is composed of 26 members.

loans.use: One sack of  second-hand clothing and one sack of handbags

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mokhled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has two children.

Mokhled gained good experience in the baking field when he used to work in a pastry shop. In 2005, he decided to open his own pastry shop. He is well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to renovate his shop and buy a generator. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and buy a generator

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KADIAMOR est créé en 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Ses femme ont constitué leur par voisinage et par affinité. Elles sont toutes activité dans le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KOBITENE

Madame MARIE EKOUDIENE D. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 06 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et/ou amis.

Grâce à CAURIE-MF elle a pu diversifier ses activités, de la vente de poissons frais elle est donc passé à la vente d'huile de palme et de balais. 

Les activités qu'elle mène grâce à l'appui de CAURIE-MF, lui ont permis de contribuer aux besoins de la famille surtout pour les dépenses quotidiennes aussi le plus souvent pour le payement de la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The Kadiamor solidarity group was created in 2008. It is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood and are either neighbors or friends. They are all active in small businesses. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois in Kobitene.

Mrs. Marie Ekoudiene D. who is standing on the right of the photo is in charge of the group. She is 45 years old, married and mother to five children. She also has six other chidren in her care who were entrusted to her by relatives or friends. Thanks to Cauri-MF she has been able to diversify her activities and has passed from the sale of fresh fish to the sale of palm oil and brooms. The business she has, thanks to the support of Caurie-MF, has allowed her to contribute to her family's needs, and above all to the daily expenses and more often than not to the children's school fees.

loans.use: To maintain her small trading activity

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a young married man who has a small child. Naimjon manufactures and sells doors and windows. He always offers reasonable prices and friendly customer service, which helped him gain a good reputation in town. Naimjon has a good discount system for all his wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for 4 years together with his father. 

Naimjon is requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase raw materials and increase the assorted merchandise he offers for sale. His business can boast very stable financial standing even in this time of economic volatility. 

Naimjon is dreaming about buying a facility for his business to save on rent expenses. We hope financial assistance will help his business grow and develop and make his dream come true one day.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing materials for door and window manufacturing

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim has a little business selling detergent goods and perfumes at the central market in Isfara, Tajikistan. An experienced entrepreneur, he has been selling for 10 years and has been successful offering good quality products for low prices. Abdurahim supports his family of five with his venture. He has requested a loan of 13,000 somoni so that he can purchase new inventory to stock his kiosks. This is Abdurahim's first loan with IMON International. The loan will greatly improve Abdurahim’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods, increasing the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Ziyovaddin

texts.en:
B. Ziyovaddin is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young Ziyovaddin has been around people raising animals. Thanks to this knowledge he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. He has been able to bring stability to his family with experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle. The desire that Ziyovaddin harbors in his heart is to increase his capital in order to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 6000 Somoni to buy more cattle as a way to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him continue to bring well being and security to the members of his family.         


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Niemeko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NIEMEKO est créé en 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles sont très solidaires et ont de forts liens de fraternité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KOBITENE.

Madame SUZANNE D. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi la charge de trois autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Les prêts qu'elle contracte régulièrement à CAURIE-MF lui offrent la possibilté d'accroitre sa vente d'huile de Palme et de jus de Citron

Son objectif est d'offrir une bonne éducation scolaire à son enfant et ceux qui lui sont confiés. Elle cherche à leur offrir un bon cadre de vie en essayant de répondre à leurs besoins quotidiennes
texts.en:
The NIEMEKO solidarity group was created in 2008. It is made up of 10 women who all come from the same district. They are very united and are linked by strong family ties. The group is part of the KOBITENE "Banc Villageois".

Mrs. Suzanne D., standing at the right-hand side of the photo, is the head of the group. She is 28 years old. She is single and the mother of one child. She is also in charge of three other children entrusted in her care by relatives. 

She regularly takes out loans from CAURIE-MF, which enable her to increase her palm oil and lemon juice sales.

Her goal is to offer a good school education to her child and to those who are entrusted in her care. She is seeking to offer them a good living environment by trying to meet their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is young and lives with his parents. He owns a retail business and sells clothes and shoes at the market. Juma has been in this business for 6 years already. He is an experienced salesperson and has a stable position at the market. He works by himself and knows how to organize this business well. His business goal is to grow bigger. Juma would like to receive a loan of $2500 USD to increase the assortment of his goods. Having more profit would help him to take better care of his parents and build his own family.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil.  He has been working in agriculture – plowing and transporting seeds and soils, since 2003.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to do the necessary maintenance to his tractor, and to continue building his house.  Mohamad had financial problems at the beginning of his business, but now his work is improving. 

Mohamad is a hard worker and a man with good reputation. He dreams of having a small family.  That's why he will use part of the loan to continue building his dream house.  In the future, he hopes to buy another tractor and expand his business.

loans.use: To maintain tractor and build house

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah K. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, all of whom are currently in school. Madinah has a poultry farm business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Madinah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for resale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein M. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Hussein has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years. He also owns rental houses.
To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as sugar and soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Hussein hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Hussein hopes to improve his family's standard of living by meeting basic needs at home.

loans.use: To purchase more items, such as sugar and soap, for resale

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat O. uses his car to operate a taxi service.  This business is his main source of income. Shuhrat has been in this business for 8 years and has been successful.  The high unemployment rate in his city required him to be creative with ways to make a living. 

Shuhrat is married and has two children. Shuhrat recently got a newer car, and though it's not expensive it requires frequent maintenance. He would like a loan of $1500 USD to use for car maintenance.  With this investment, Shuhrat will be able to expand his business, a success that will bring a better quality of life to his family.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for car

loans.name: Herbart

texts.en:
Herbart M. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Herbart has a medical clinic business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Herbart has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Herbart hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his medical clinic further.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Janet has a secretarial services business, which she has run for two years. She is also a salary earner.
To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase computers for her secretarial business. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to open a training center offering computer lessons.

loans.use: To purchase computers for her secretarial business

loans.name: Havas

texts.en:
B. Havas works with her husband in a business buying and reselling cows.  She has 4 children. Havas would like to request a loan of USD 1,500 in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue, and  ultimately greater profit for her family. 

In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. Havas plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. 

You can become an important part in Havas family's life.  She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to own a pork joint (small restaurant) and a bar.

texts.en:
Rashid is a hardworking person.  He makes an effort to give his beloved children the best.   Rashid decided to stay on his land so that he can develop it.  Now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.  

With the experience gained over 5 years in the purchasing and sales of cattle, Rashid has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase additional cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason he has requested a loan for USD1500.  Rashid thanks you very much for your support.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical items, such as electrical wires, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Juma hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes to own another branch of the same business.

Majmoua in order to buy extra iron and wood pillars to use in his business.  

Ali has been an A. Majmoua borrower since 2009.  He is a man with a good repayment history. Ali is working hard to improve his business and to expand it. He hopes to open a construction company in the future.

Being a new business, he is still making progress.  The future prospects though are looking brighter everyday due to his determination and optimism. Davita also sells bananas and coffee to supplement on his profits. Monthly, he earns 200,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more sugar, rice and sodas to resell.

texts.en:
29-year-old Sylvia N. is a used clothes sales businesswoman who operates from Bushenyi market in western Uganda.  Sylvia is single and has no children.  She has been in her business for 2 years.  

Second-hand clothing is popular in most rural parts of Uganda because it is cheap. Needless to say, most people residing in these areas live below the poverty line. Sylvia was once part of that group. It was after she had done much thinking over her narrow circumstances and their implications that she decided she had to bring value to her life through running a business. Since she began, hard work has become a byword associated with her.  Monthly, her business generates 250,000 shillings.

N. belongs to Nyamirima Twimukye group-Bushenyi.  She says that with the loan, she is going to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

texts.en:

Ali is a man with good reputation.  He is loved by most of his friends and neighbors.  Ali hopes to expand his business and succeed in order to open his own photography studio, which is his dream.  He loves taking pictures of people and places.  Ali's clients can be anyone seeking fun, knowledge or friendship, since they can come and search for what they want.

loans.use: To upgrade computers

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en:
Farkhad A. is from Sabirabad. He is 49 years old, married, and is blessed with two sons. The high aim for Farkhad is to provide a better life for this family and to give a good education to his children. His wife helps him in this goal. They are a very diligent family. 

To improve their living, Farkhad has been engaged in a trading business for over 10 years. After the first loan taken out from AqroInvest and Kiva, the income of his family increased up to 500 AZN per month.   Farkhad was able to open a new grocery store.  He is very thankful for the support rendered to him.

With the help of this second loan in the amount of 1500 AZN, Farkhad stocked the shelves of his store with more goods. After he repays this loan, he plans to apply for more loans to grow his business and to enlarge his new store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for grocery store

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy two new sewing machines and a generator. She is aiming to expand her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

texts.en: 54-year-old Eldard K. is affiliated with Katagata  Farmers group-Bushenyi.   This happily married father of 7 has been engaged in a cattle sales business in Katagata for the past 9 years. Eldard also has a side banana sales business. He says it has been through the savings from his banana trade that he was able to take root in this cattle business. Eldard says that his determination and tenacity have gotten him this far. Weekly, the cattle  business generates for him 100,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase a young calf.

He is requesting a $1,200 loan to decorate his shop. He is planning to grow bigger in the future and increase his profits.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco comunal “Amigo”, perteneciente a la comuna de Recoleta. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de uniformes escolares hace 17 años y desde  hace 3 años tiene un taller que acomodó en el patio de su casa. Su familia le ayuda en el corte y confección de los uniformes escolares; su hija borda y su marido después de su trabajo le ayuda a cortar las telas. 
Tiene como clientes frecuentes a 2 colegios, a los cuales entrega uniformes escolares (faldas, pantalones, buzos), durante el periodo de noviembre a abril. Además Sonia tiene clientes particulares, a los que les confecciona buzos y parkas en temporada de invierno.
Con este préstamo, Sonia comprará telas y cuellos para poleras. 
Su sueño es aumentar el número de clientes; es decir incluir como un cliente frecuente a un colegio más y también aumentar sus clientes particulares, de esta manera aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos. Sumado a esto ser reconocida.
Para Sonia los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido fundamentales en su negocio, ya que le han permitido financiar y aumentar su producción. Gracias a los ingresos de su negocio Sonia ha podido financiar  los estudios superiores de su hija.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Amigo” communal bank in Recoleta.  She has been manufacturing and selling school uniforms for the past 17 years.  For the past three years she’s had a workshop installed in her patio.  Her family helps her cut and assemble the school uniforms; her daughter embroiders and her husband helps her cut after he gets home from work.

Two schools are her frequent buyers.  She delivers school uniforms to them (skirts, pants and sweatshirts) from November through April.  Sonia also has individual customers for whom she makes sweatshirts and parkas for winter.  With this loan Sonia will buy fabric and collars for t-shirts.

Her dream is to increase her number of customers; in other words, include an additional school as a regular customer as well as increase her individual customers so that production will increase and thus her profits as well.  And in addition to this, she wants to be well known.

For Sonia, loans from Fondo Esperanza have been fundamental for her business because they have made it possible to finance and increase production.  Thanks to income from her business Sonia has been able to pay for her daughter’s higher education.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes in Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central part of Santiago’s metropolitan area.  It has active commerce, a notable neighborhood being Patronato which has welcomed principally Arab merchants (at the beginning) and Koreans (now).

loans.use: For fabric and shirt collars.

loans.name: Solidario Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Buena Vista: La Señora Beatriz S. se dedica a la venta de refaccion en especial venta de tamales, por otro lado tambien vende ropa, como blusas, y oro brasileño, desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a la venta ambulante,con la ayuda de su esposo y la de sus hijos ella a salido adelante, ella como encargada del grupo anima a sus compañeras para seguir luchando por sus sueños, doña Lidia Rebeca M.: su deceo es seguir luchando y sacar adelante a su familia su sueño es poder tener una libreria  mas grande donde pueda tener bariedad en papeleria o utiles para escuela, doña Alida Violeta H.: es una mujer muy luchadora ella vende elados, pero tambien vende tamales de con sus luchas a sacado adelante a sus familia y le a podido dar lo nesesario a sus hijos. Las señora solicitan esta credito para compra de productos comestibles para tienda y para elavorar tamales y compra de mercaderia para libreria
texts.en:
Buena Vista Communal Bank:  Mrs. Beatriz S. sells food, especially tamales.  She also sells clothes, like blouses, and Brazilian gold.  She has been a street vendor for the last 6 years.  With help from her husband and children she has been getting ahead.  As group leader she encourages her fellow members to continue fighting for their dreams.

Mrs. Lidia Rebeca M. wants to continue fighting to support her family.  Her dream is to have a larger bookstore where she can stock a variety of paper goods or school supplies.

Mrs. Alida Violeta Hernández is a very hard working woman who sells ice cream but also sells tamales.  Through her struggles she has managed to support her family and provide the basics for her children.

The women are asking for a loan to buy food items for the store and to make tamales and to buy merchandise for the bookstore.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for the store and to make tamales and to buy merchandise for the bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Camino Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella vende ropa interior (lencería) de adultos y niños por catálogo, desde hace 8 años. También Norma es peluquera y trabaja medio día (durante la tarde), de lunes a sábado en una peluquería. Además realiza trabajos  particulares como peluquera, pero a domicilio. 
Con este préstamo comprará un catálogo de ropa interior actualizado de otoño - invierno y los encargos de sus clientes. Para lo que viajará a Santiago, como todos los meses, cada 15 días.
Norma vive con su esposo, quien recibe una pequeña pensión y su hija quien es mayor de edad y trabaja de forma dependiente medio día.
El sueño de Norma es tener una peluquería.
Para Norma Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo que le ha permitido crecer en su negocio, ya que gracias a los préstamos puede comprar los materiales de peluquería para trabajar de manera particular y ha mantenido su negocio de ropa interior.
Además le han servido mucho el talleres de educación emprendedora, especialmente uno referente a cómo ahorrar organizando sus gastos y ganancias, el cual se les enseño a su grupo durante una reunión de Fondo Esperanza, de parte de su asesor.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Camino Esperanza” (Hope Road) communal bank in the city of Viña del Mar.  She has sold underwear (lingerie) for adults and children via catalogue for the last 8 years.  She is also a barber and works half days (in the afternoon) from Monday through Saturday in a barber shop.  In addition, she provides private in-home barber services.

She will use this loan to buy a current fall-winter lingerie catalogue and her customer’s pending orders.  To do so, she will travel to Santiago like she does monthly, every two weeks.

Norma lives with her husband who receives a small pension and her adult daughter who works independently half days.Norma’s dream is to own a barber shop.

For Norma, Fondo Esperanza has been a great help in that it has made it possible for her business to grow because thanks to the loans she has been able to buy barber supplies to work privately and has been able to stay in the lingerie business. In addition the business training workshops, especially those on how to save by organizing costs and profits, have been very useful.  These were taught by her Fondo Esperanza advisor during a group meeting.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune along the Chilean coast.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the old homes in the city have.  It is also known as Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: For the fall-winter catalogue and for lingerie orders.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two grown children. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk. Sergey sells bags, backpacks, suitcases etc. He also offers a leather accessories' repair service. Currently, Sergey has 90,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His income is 8,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Sergey started his business as a small market vendor 3 years ago. Then he switched his sales location from the marketplace to a rented facility in a local mall called "City" in downtown Novomoskovsk. Sergey has a granddaughter who was born a few months ago. He loves her very much and babysits sometimes.

Sergey is seeking a 20,000 Grivnyas loan to increase his product range. He is hoping to receive additional income and to help his child raise his granddaughter.

loans.use: to increase his range of products

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, labora como conserje para ayudar con el sustento de la familia. Es madre de cuatro hijos. En donde su meta ha sido la construcción de su pequeña casa, que ha venido mejorando por medio de los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado con doce ciclos. Y él  apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la mecánica.
Lo que hará con este nuevo  préstamo es la construcción de un pequeño muro para reguardar su propiedad. Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra que será de mucho beneficio para la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Melania is a woman of limited financial resources. She works as a janitor to help support her family. Melania is the mother of four children and her goal is to build a small house. She has been making progress with the loans she has received from AFODENIC. Melania has participated in twelve loan cycles. She has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic.

With this new loan, Melania plans to build a small wall in order to protect her property. She will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron so that the work can begin. This will be of great benefit by providing security for her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a security wall on her property

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina, es una mujer alegre, de 36 años. Su familia lo integra su esposo Emerson, y sus 5 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; en armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la agricultura, siendo sus principales cultivos el café, plátano, y palta. Tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello y lo que más le gusta es comenzar la búsqueda de los primeros granos maduros de café durante el inicio de la cosecha. Su dedicación y el amor que brinda a sus cultivos, hacen que sus productos sean de buena calidad. Por ello conocedores de su buen trabajo los comerciantes de café de la ciudad de Villa Rica, la buscan constantemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá salir adelante. Bernardina tiene un vivero de 2 mil plantitas de café, por ello con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar personal para que le ayuden en trasplantar café.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 36, is a cheerful woman. Her family is made up of her husband, Emerson, and their five minor children.  They live in family harmony in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).

Bernardina is a farmer; her main crops are coffee, banana and avocado.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and what she enjoys the most is looking for the first ripe coffee beans at the beginning of the harvest.  The dedication and love she provides her crops result in good quality products.  Because of this her work is well known and coffee merchants in the city of Villa Rica seek her out constantly.

She is a member of the “Prestatarios de la Unión” (La Unión Borrowers) and this is her first loan with MFP where she is sure to get ahead.  Bernardina has a nursery with 2000 coffee seedlings so she is asking for a loan to hire personnel to help her transplant coffee.

loans.use: To hire personnel to help her transplant coffee.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nemesio de 38 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La bodega de Julia es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia, 36, is an unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Nemesio, 38, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Julia’s store is the first one to open in her town.  Her doors open at 6am and she’s ready to receive early rising buyers who, aware of the variety of merchandise she has in her store, don’t hesitate to buy from her because they are sure to find the things they need.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers learning what’s going on in town.  She has been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay inside her store all day without being able to go out. In time she hopes her business will grow so that she can provide better customer service.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time because she does not want to cause problems for her fellow communal bank members where she is much respected because of the order she imposes on the group. She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy more products to better stock her store with groceries.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two grown-up sons. She is a small-market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Natalya sells retail items such as household products, ceramic figurines, dishware, thermometers, brushes and batteries. Her kiosk always offers a nice selection of assorted merchandise which attracts potential customers. As well as selling retail, she also offers bulk prices thus helping smaller entrepreneurs to buy items from her and to make a living.

Natalya has been in the trade for seven years. She has invested about 75,000 Grivnyas in her venture. She is working hard to sustain her business and secure its expansion. Natalya is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. This loan will enable Natalya to provide a wide range of assorted products for sale in her kiosk and will help guarantee consistent growth in her business.

loans.use: to increase the product range

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements and canceling a Citybank credit card.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es:
Luisa  es una mujer de edad avanzada y con mucho deseo de seguir trabajando para lograr el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda.
Hoy en día labora en una empresa privada como conserje, en donde espera seguir hasta que se jubile.
Su casa la ha venido mejorando con préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en donde ha logrado hacer cuartos y ahora con este nuevo financiamiento lograra cambiar techo del bajarete de atrás ya que necesita hacer este cambio ante que empiece el invierno. Lo que comprara láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, y comenzar. A si como hacer otro cuarto que espera a futuro lograrlo a través de los financiamientos que han sido
texts.en:
Luisa is an elderly woman who has great drive to continue working so that she can make further improvements to her home. Today she works as a janitor for a private business, a place where she hopes to remain until she retires.

Her home has undergone improvements. With the loans she received from AFODENIC, Luisa was able to add rooms. Now with this new loan, she plans to replace the roof over her patio before winter begins. She will buy sheets of zinc, lumber, and nails so that the work can begin. Luisa wants to build an additional room, so she hopes to obtain another loan in the future to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace the roof above her patio

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abilio de 49  años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Zoila ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva plátano y café, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 49 years old, is a very personable and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house with her husband Abilio, 49, and their 3 beloved children, whom she wants to give a better quality of life. With much effort, Zoila has managed to work her lands and make them very productive. She grows plantains and coffee, which she then takes to the city of Pichanaki, where she sells them wholesale. 

Her crops have given her the income necessary to support her family, and so she wants to put all her efforts into getting ahead in this business. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops; she has spent 20 years doing so. The most difficult part is transporting her goods to the market, since the bags she carries are very heavy and tire her very much. Eventually, she hopes to improve her crops and thereby improve her income. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to be so this time as well. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is always aware of the agreements of the others in her group. With the 1000 soles ($375) requested, she will buy composted manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: Purchase bags of manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase edible products to make food

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Nadezhda sells perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products in the central marketplace of her home town. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnyas in this business; the profit is 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda started her enterprise 3 years ago. Today, Nadezhda owns a container-store. Container-stores are large metal shipping containers often used for overseas shipping. They can be used for storage, but make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise.

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase her working capital. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes and more crates of drinks

loans.name: Duo Esfuerzo Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Duo Esfuerzo del Mañana: Este grupo esta foramdo por doña Emilia P. de 43 años, casada Con dos Hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por mas de 15 años, Solicita este credito para la compra de ropa por mayor, tambien esta doña Cristina C. ella es la lider de este grupo ella tiene su tienda de productos comestibles, ella nos cuenta que le a hido muy bien en su negocio, gracias al apoyo de fape ella a hido superandose, ademas esta solicitando un nuevo credito para surtir su tienda con utiles escolares, y asi seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Tomorrow’s Effort Duo:  This group is made up of Mrs. Emilia P., 43.  She’s married and has two children.  She’s been selling clothes for over 15 years.  She is asking for this loan to buy clothes at wholesale.

Also in it is Mrs. Cristina C..  She is the group leader and has a grocery store.  She tells us that she’s done very well in the business. Thanks to support from FAPE she’s been improving.  She’s asking for anew loan to stock her store with school supplies thus continuing with her business.

loans.use: To buy school supplies at wholesale and to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Khawar

texts.en:
The American Dream is about inspiring people to think big and use pure ingenuity to create a business that is beneficial to all. Khawar is a perfect example of this dream and the drive to succeed. 

Born in Pakistan, Khawar built a 15-year-career drawing from his degrees in management, physics and applied mathematics. A background in these fields has led to the pursuit of a start-up venture in the green industry and his current job at Giant Stadium is a far cry from where his ambition could take him.  

With this loan from ACCION USA, Khawar will be developing a prototype of the solar-powered air conditioner/chiller. While production and design are in their early stages, the goal is to create technology that will meet the energy needs of the developing world in a way that is sustainable financially and environmentally. 

This capital and the support of his family will give Khawar the foundation for success as a social entrepreneur.

loans.use: To create a prototype of a solar powered air conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra Q., de 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, esta casada con Demetrio de 35 años y tienen 04; viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Palmapampa distrito de Samugari. Alejandra, es campesina, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niña, desde entonces ha trabajado en esta actividad alrededor de 10 años; cultivando los siguientes productos: cacao, café, hojas de coca y plátano, productos que son extraídos gracias a los jornaleros que contrata durante la temporada de cosecha. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos.
