Lila desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo de arroz, ella espera obtener una buena cosecha para que le pueda generar ingresos. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lila is 71 years old, a widow, and she lives with her three children in the Bebederos sector, a rural region that is primarily agricultural. It is locate din the district of Oyotun, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. 

Lila has been involved in agricultural activities since the passing of her husband. She and her children take charge of managing the rice plantation on a small plot of land they own. She loves her work and with the income she earns she is able to provide for her family. 

Lila needs to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice plantation. She wants to obtain a good harvest to generate better earnings. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: José Gaston

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a Don José, el tiene 58 años de edad, está divorciado pero de esa relación  tiene dos hijos mayores de edad  que viven con sus familias respectivas, pero de un nuevo compromiso tiene un niño de dos años que es su alegría. Su mujer se dedica a las tareas del hogar.

El tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo, donde vende productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos compra en Portoviejo y también  recibe algunos productos en su  local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su tienda ya por cuatro años y que hay días buenos y otros no tanto pero que  igual le da para mantenerse él y su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro” meet in the September 30th neighborhood of the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and well-known throughout the country.

It is here one can find Don José. He is 58 years old, divorced, and maintains relationships with his two adult children who live with their own families. His new wife has a two year old child who brings him joy. She handles the household chores.

José has a grocery store where he sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other items. He works every day from 6am to 10pm and sometimes much later. José buys his products in Portoviejo and some of them are shipped to his store. He says that he has been in business for four years. There are good days and others days when he earns just enough to support himself and his family.

This loan will be used to restock his store even more. He will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessities. José has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the fact that the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions. His goals include moving forward with his business and growing his store each day.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Rosa es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por el sector de Narancay Bajo  que se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, en este sector su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura y también mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
 
La Señorita. Rosa J. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres la misma que es propia, su mamá se dedica a la venta de chancho asado y su papa es de profesión chofer.
> 
Nuestra socia se dedica a ayudar en el negocio de su madre en donde trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 2 años y  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para la venta. Su meta es crecer en el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Srta. Rosa is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the Narancay Bajo sector, which is located ten minutes away from the city of Cuenca. The residents of this sector engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. Many of them also work in the city in different businesses.

Srta. Rosa J. is 27 years old, single, and lives at the home of her parents which she calls her own. Her mother sells roasted pork and her father is a professional driver.

Rosa helps with her mother’s business and works Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 8pm. She has been with her Communal Bank for two years and the money from this loan will be invested in pork to sell. Her goal is to grow the family business.

loans.use: Purchase pork

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra S. es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive en la comunidad de Rumiloma que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi,  esta parroquia es nombrada como el balcón de la ciudad.
 
Doña Mayra tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos hijos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de unos familiares.

La Señora. Mayra se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cría animales como cerdos, borregos y cuyes, los que vende en su comunidad. También siembra hortalizas  que son  para la venta y para su consumo.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra S. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Rumiloma which is in the parish of Turi. This parish is also known as the “balcony” of the city.

Doña Mayra is 27 years old, married, and has two children (ages 9 and 5). Her children attend school in the city. Her husband works as a mason. They do not own a house, so they live at the home of relatives.

Sra. Mayra devotes herself to the household chores and raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs that she sells in her community. In addition, she grows crops to sell and for personal consumption.

Mayra is in her sixth loan cycle with the Communal Bank. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal San Pablo vive en la comunidad de Rumiloma que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia nombrada como el balcón de la ciudad.
 
Doña María tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, seis son casados de los cuales cuatro  viven independientes y dos viven en su casa y comparten gastos, su hijo soltero trabaja y también ayuda en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar  y cría pollo los que vende en su comunidad, también lava ropa ajena.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para sus pollos. Su meta es  tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
Sra. María P. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Rumiloma which is in the parish of Turi. This parish is also known as the “balcony” of the city.

Doña María is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. Six of her children are married, but four of them live independently. The other two married children live at home and share the expenses. Her child who is single works and also helps with the household finances. Her husband is a mason and was responsible for building their house.

Sra. María devotes herself to the household chores and raising chickens that she sells in her community. She also does laundry for other people.

María has been with the Communal Bank for three years. The money from her loan will be invested in the construction of a coop for her chickens. Her goal is to have a larger poultry farm.

loans.use: Build a chicken coop

loans.name: Lucia Lucrecia

texts.es: Lucia Tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera, comerciante, ella esta solicitando su primer credito en asociacion ASDIR, ya que es muy reconicida por la venta de blusas y delantales, y necesita de esta ayuda para ayudar economicamente a su familia.
texts.en: Lucia is 30 years old and single.  She is a merchant who is requesting her first loan from Asociación ASDIR.  Lucia is known for selling blouses and aprons.  She is in need of assistance so that she can financially support her family.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn G. is from the village of Lopoc, Labson, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old and is single. Jerelyn operates a family member's business venture offering general services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jerelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jerelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de materiales para fabricar muebles

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María G. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, la gente de esta parroquia se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, son personas carismáticas y muy amables.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y está al cuidado de sus hijos, también cría  animales como: cerdos, aves y ganado a los mismos que los compra y los vende. Ella trabaja en la agricultura que es más para su consumo.

La Señora. María tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo trabajan para sus gastos personales y también estudian, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su hija de 6 años estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo y sacrifico conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María G. is a member of the Los Talvos community bank.  She lives in the community of San Miguel, in El Valle parish.  The people from this parish work in sales, crop farming and livestock farming.  They are charismatic and very kind people.

María takes care of her housework and her children.  She also raises animals such as pigs, poultry and other livestock that she buys and sells.  She mainly raises animals for her family's own use.

María is 38 years old, married, and has 6 children aged 20, 18, 16, 6, 4 and 2.  Her first and third sons work to cover their personal expenses and also study.  Her second child (a daughter) works and helps with the household finances.  Her 6 year-old daughter is studying at an elementary school in the community.  Her husband works as a construction worker and, through hard work and joint sacrifice, they have managed to build their own home.

María has been a member of her community bank for 13 years.  She will invest her new loan in buying pigs.  Her goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Amarsaihan

texts.en:
Amarsaihan, 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Both children attend a local school. 

She began a firewood and coal trading business in 2006. Her husband helps her to operate the business which has become very stable. In the summer time they transport firewood using their own vehicle. They plan to have their own location where they can sell firewood and coal. Amarsaihan is an honest and modest person who says, "My husband and I work hard to expand our business since we will need more money for our children's future education."

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT  to purchase more coal to sell in the near future to increase their working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more coal

loans.name: Hilda Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, la gente en esta parroquia se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, son personas carismáticas y muy amables.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita. Su esposo es de profesión electricista y con su trabajo y el de su esposo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Hilda se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y cría pollos, cerdos, cuyes y ganado a los que vende en la feria de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y fue invitada por sus amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y también para realizar otra chanchera. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in the community of  San Miguel, which belongs to the El Valle parish. People in this parish work as merchants, in agriculture and in raising animals. They are charismatic and kind people.  

Hilda is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children, aged 17 and 11. Her oldest daughter goes to high school and her youngest son is in elementary school.  Her husband is an electricist and with her husband's job, they have been able to build their own home. 

Hilda takes care of the home and raises chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and cattle, which she sells at the city market. 

The is her third loan she has taken out with the communal bank. She was asked to join by her friends. She will invest the loan in purchasing pigs and also making a new pigsty. Her goal is to grow the business of raising animals more.

loans.use: To buy pigs and build a pigsty

loans.name: Clara Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señora Clara es socia del banco comunal comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de La Victoria Alta que perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, la gente en esta parroquia se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, son personas carismáticas y muy amables.

Doña Clara tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como empleado privado y con su sacrificio han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Clara se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en la casa también cría pollos y cerdos que los que vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en ella. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cerdos. Su meta es darles  la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in the community of La Victoria Alta, which belongs to the El Valle parish. The people of this parish work as merchants, in agriculture and in raising animals. They are charismatic and kind people.  

Clara is 28 years old and is in a common law marriage and has 3 children, aged 7, 5 and 3. Her two oldest children go to an elementary school in the area. Her husband works in a private business and with their hard work they have been able to build their own home.  

Clara takes care of her children and since she is in the home, she also raises chicken and pigs that she sells in the community. 


She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it and has good friends there. She will invest the money from the loan in purchasing more pigs. Her goal is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey S. lines in Kansaom Ak village in Takeo province. He was born in 1975. He and his wife, Mrs. Et Loeung, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a bread seller and a laborer. In the dry season, he has some problems when it is time to grow rice. So, to improve production, Mr. Mey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire farm laborers. 

He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school while the other is too small to work or study. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire farm laborers to grow rice

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros L. lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She was born in 1967. She is a widow with two children who are employed in garment factories. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. In the rice field, she has some problems because it is time for growing rice during the dry season. So, to improve production, Mrs. Ros L. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Moeurn S. has been a farming business woman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kampong Cham. Since 2000, she has owned and operated her farm where she cultivates rice to earn a daily income. Moeurn S., 29, is a married woman who has two children. Both of them are single and are still studying in school. Her husband also supports her in the same business. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year and it may affect Moeurn S.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Moeurn S. is taking out a loan to purchase some pipes and a water pump for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase some pipes and a water pump for her crops.

loans.name: Gerelee

texts.en: Gerelee, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse at a hospital and his two children attend a local secondary school. They are fortunate to own a home and land as well as maintain a decent standard of living. In 2010 Gerelee opened a grocery store near his home. He purchases food from wholesale stores and sells it at his grocery store which is located on the outskirts of the city. He wants to expand his shop and sell a wider variety of food. Gerelee is an honest and modest person who says "I would like to enlarge my shop and make more money in order to save for my children's future education." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell at his shop so that he can increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase food to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas C., 56, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on his own land for many years. He is married to Ran, age 53, who assists him in the farming business. In addition, his wife also raises a few pigs in a stall at their home. The family typically generates a profit of around $4.60 per day. 

The couple is blessed with five children; three are single, and two are married. Two of the children are employed as sewing workers at a garment factory, where they earn a formal salary every month.

 Because his farm lacks a watering system, Meas C. would like a loan to buy an irrigation pump.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok R. was born in 1966. She lives in R. village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Vung, also pictured,  are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  Mr. Nhor Vung is also a cow middleman. 

Mrs. Mok R. has had some difficulties with the rice field due to the dry season. To improve her rice production, Mrs. Mok R. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer,  rice seed,  pesticide, and to plow the rice field. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is a laborer.  The other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich Y. is 60 years old, and she lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. She is single and she lives with three family members.

Mrs. Pich Y. earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Because her business is doing well, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her standard of living.  She is pictured with her niece.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun, 45, is married with three children.  He and his family live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His daughter goes to college and his youngest son attends a local secondary school. His oldest son used to live with them but is now married and has begun his own life. 

Batchuluun's family currently lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. He is a leather production specialist and began his boot-making and trading business in 1996. He makes boots at home and sells them at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. His wife and children help him to operate the business. They make up to five pairs of boots a day which sell for 20,000 MNT in the warmer seasons and 25,000-30,000 MNT in the wintertime. His monthly profit is 250,000-300,000 MNT. 

Because he is an expert in boot making and has been doing this business for several years he has not tried any other business.  Batchuluun ia a hard-working man who wants to increase his production and expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more leather and rubber materials, which are essential for making boots.

loans.use: To purchase more leather and rubber

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men T. is 58 years old, and she lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. In Pov (pictured), are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice to sell for a living.

However, they lack money to grow rice.  To support their farm, Mrs. Men T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay hired laborers to plow her farm.

This couple has six children.  Three are farmers and the other three are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa, 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Tuv province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her father-in-law's backyard. Her two daughters attend the local secondary school. 

Alimaa graduated from a vocational school as a seamstress in 1990. She worked for a clothing factory as a tailor and a supervisor between 1997 and 2007. Then she started her own sewing business in 2010 which she operates currently. Since she has enough experience in this field, she wants to expand her business and make high quality clothing. Alimaa is a modest person who wishes to have her own clothing factory in the future. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more sewing machines for her workshop.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Chhnang province, Soem R. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over fifty sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make extra profit. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Usually, the couple can earn an average of $3.50 per day for supporting their family’s needs. 

Due to the coming harvest season, Soem R. would like to purchase many sacks of rice to store and then resell when prices are high. Soem R. is a 65-year-old married woman blessed with three children, and all of her children are married.

loans.use: To purchase rice to stock up while prices are low for future sales.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S. is 48 years old and she lives in Ta Hing village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoem Thorn, are coffee sellers whereby they can earn a little income to support their family. They also own a food stall for selling groceries. 

Mrs. Phorn S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. With both of these businesses, they hope to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living. 

This couple has seven children. Three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the others are students and also support their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to expand her business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom H. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a farmer. Mom lives in Rung village in Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer cakes. She wants to grow rice in the dry season, and she needs some money to support that. 

To improve her rice production, Mrs. Mom H. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and to plow the rice field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and to plow the rice field

loans.name: Davaamaa

texts.en:
Davaamaa, 40, is a widow and lives with her three sons in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Her older son goes to college and the younger two attend a local school. Now they live in a ger, a Mongolian housing tent, in someone's backyard close to the city center, since the land that they own is too far away. 

Davaamaa began selling animal hides in 1990. She purchases animal hides at the local market or from residents in the countryside that visit her. She sells them to larger wholesalers if she can collect enough daily. She owns a car and uses it for her business. She wishes to increase her working capital so that she can start a wholesale animal hides business in the future. Davaamaa is a hardworking and brave person whose wish is to become a successful businesswoman. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more animal hides so she can make more profit by selling them for a higher price.

loans.use: To purchase more animal hides

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. lives in Thommeakney village in Takeo province and she was born in 1960. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a computer company. The others are attending a local public school.

Sar is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she grows both rice and vegetables for selling to support her family. She is a duck breeder, too. 

She has some problems with her land and it is time for growing rice. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sar S. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech S. is a 43-year-old married mother caring for two kids who study in the local public school in Kompong Tom province. She makes rattan cupboards and beds. Since 2007, Pech S. and her husband have been selling her finished products from their home. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders, and then takes them to sell at retail prices door-to-door across the province. They always take a week or two in selling their products. Pech S. is now running her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. In order to earn more income, Pech S. seeks a loan to buy more beds for selling than at the present time.

loans.use: To buy more beds for selling.

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members. It is located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mi C. is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the other members. She is a vegetable seller in the market where she can earn a little income to support her family. With this business, she still earns less income than needed to support the family. So in order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business activities. 
 
Mrs. Mi C. is 41 years old, and she is a widow with four children. Two of them are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a student, while the last one stays at home.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business activities.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 54 years old and lives with her daughter, son-in-law and niece in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son-in-law works as a bus driver for a company that transports people between Ulaanbaatar and the western provinces, and her daughter is currently unemployed. 

Oyunchimeg is a single mom who takes care of her children. She began a clothing trading business in 2010. She sells women's lingerie, hats and scarves in the winter at an outdoor stall where she pays 100,000 MNT a month for rent. Her daily income is about $57 and her monthly profit ranges between $244 and $325. She purchases her clothing once a month from China.

Oyumchimeg wants to rent another stall for her daughter where she can operate a clothing business and have her own income. Oyunchimeg says, "Now I am getting older, and I want my daughter to start a business and have a source of constant income." She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to rent one more stall and provide a job for her daughter.

loans.use: To rent one more stall

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon K. is a villager in Thommeakney village in Takeo province. She was born in 1949. She is a widow with three children who are seamstresses in garment factories. She owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. 

Recently she wants to start a new business breeding cows, but her savings is not enough money. So she is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos S. is a 30-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids, both of whom are attending the public high school. Her husband, Chan Sarom, is 29 and works as a worker at the garment industry, and has a regular salary of about $4 a day. Ruos S.’s husband complains that it is hard to travel to work because he doesn’t have a vehicle. He goes to work by taxi or he walks. 

Ruos S. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

Note: Ruos S. and her youngest child are in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig, 28, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a house that they own. His wife is not employed and takes care of their one year old daughter. The older son attends a local secondary school. 

Ganzorig has been operating a coal business in the winter and a vegetable business in the summer since 2006. Now he owns a mini-truck, but wants to buy a new, bigger truck. Their house is located near a busy road where he hopes to open a tire repair service on his property in the near future. 

Ganzorig is a modest and hard working man.  He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his mini-truck and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ut's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people. Tthey are located in Lekh Bei village in Kandal province. This group loan has selected, Mrs. Ut Y. as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portions to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Ut Y. is a rice and food seller who owns a food stall to support her business. She would like to ask for a loan to buy food supplies to support her business. 

Mrs. Ut Y. is widow and doesn’t have any children.

loans.use: To buy food supplies to support her business.

loans.name: Tsomonbaatar

texts.en:
Tsomonbaatar, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they purchased 20 years ago. His older son Boldbaatar, 9, attends a local primary school. His relatives take care of livestock he owns in the countryside. 

in the beginning he started a public transportation business using his own car in 1999 and would transport people between the local towns. Then, he tried to operate a welding service business by renting a workshop at a local market but gave it up due to the insufficient income. After that, he decided to buy a motorbike to start his taxi business which currently earns him a daily income of 10,000 MNT. He also uses his motorbike to go to the countryside to check the condition of his livestock. He says that he spends less money on  gas and earns more money by using a motorcycle. 

Tsomonbaatar is a hardworking and modest person who says, " I want to save money to build a bigger house where we can have a comfortable life". He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and for maintenance costs for his motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Trap

texts.en:
Mrs. Trap L. who is living in Prey Phkoam Ko village in Takeo province was born in 1970. She is married to Mr. Saron Meou. This couple supports five children who are attending a local public school. The children also help with their parents businesses. 

Mrs. Trap L. is a pig breeder who is able to earn some money to support her family while her husband is a farmer who owns a 1.52-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family.He is also raises cows. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Trap L. is requesting  a loan to buy more piglets, pig feed, and with the rest of the loan she is going to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Paok's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. It is located in Cheung Prey Bei village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Paok S. is 57 years old, and she is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She is a fruit seller in the local market where she can earn a little income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit for resell. 

Mrs. Paok S. is widow with three children. One child is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer, and one is stays at home and helps her mother business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resell.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Four people form this group loan. They are located in Roka village in Kandal province. This group loan selected, Mrs. Chin Y. who is 38 years old to be the group leader. The members of this group hope to increase their income to improve the family lifestyle by this loan.

Mrs. Chin Y. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare of land which she uses to cultivate rice. With this farm, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for cultivating rice. Aside from farmer, she also earns her living by fish breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sruo Sarun, is a fisherman who is able to earn a little income in support of the family. 

This couple is working hard to support their five children who are all students and also support their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and gasoline to cultivating rice.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Va S. is a 49-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she sell Khmer noodle in the morning to the neighbors in and around her community. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Mrs. Va S. was married, but she divorced from her husband several years ago. She lives with her three children; all of whom are single, and one of them is working in the ferment factory as a sewing worker, earning a profit of approximately $80 per month. Her daughter always shares her salary with Mrs. Va S. to use in the daily expenses. 

Because her daughter doesn’t have her own vehicle to ride to work, Mrs. Va S. would like to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to ride to her job location.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughter to ride to her job.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn N. is a married woman who has five children, two of whom are construction workers. The others are attending a local public school. She was born in 1963 and lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a farming laborer who is able to earn some moN. to support her family while her husband, Mr. Trach Porn, is a fisherman who also earns an income to support their family. Although they work hard, they can  income is small. 

So to improve this condition, Mrs. Phorn N. is requesting for a loan to buy two piglets and pig feed  to start a new business, breeding pigs.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig feed for breeding

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
In Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province, these are four people have formed a group loan. 

Mrs. Sun Y. was born in 1960, and she is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Yang Borei are rice wine makers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family’s condition, Mrs. Sun Y. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feedd. 

This couple has two children who are the students and who also support their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and pig feed.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
These four people form a group loan; they are located in Preaek Traeng village in Kandal province.  

Mr. Kong P. was born in 1963 and he was selected as the group leader by the other members.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to cultivate rice that he sells to support his family.  In order to support his farming, he would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for cultivating rice.  His wife, Mrs. Un Savén is a fishing seller in the market who is able to earn a little income to support her family. 

This couple has four children: one of whom is a car driver and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members; they are located in Preaek Chhmouh village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mom S. was born in 1966 and has been chosen the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by the other members.  She and her husband, Mr. Y Von, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice that they sell to support their family.  Aside from farming, they also earn a living by renting big speakers to those who have a party such as a wedding or birthday party.  In order to support the big speaker business, Mrs. Mom S. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more big speakers for rent. 

This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy more big speakers for rent.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mrs. Un S. lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province and she was born in 1963.  She is a Khmer cake seller in local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family and she is a duck breeder too.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  So to improve her business, Mrs. Un S. is asking for a loan to buy more than two hundred ducks and duck food for breeding.  She is a widow who has a child who is married.

loans.use: To buy more than two hundred ducks and duck food for breeding

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda D. L. C. is from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is 46 years old.  Luzviminda is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Luzviminda from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the house and provide capital for her business

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar S., 41, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. His older son attends local high school and his younger son goes to kindergarten. 

Uuganbayar started operating his current food store in 2000. His wife works at the store as a salesperson. Uuganbayar also works for a company as a security guard where he spends three days a week. Besides working as a security guard and operating his food store, he drives a taxi. 

He is a hardworking man who is trying to save money for his children's further study. He says, " I want to expand my business and increase my profit in order to give the opportunity to my children to study at a college."  He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell and increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. is from the village of Siari. He is 47 years old. Ronald is married with three children. To make a living, Ronald owns and operates a sari-sari store. He also sells gasoline in his store by the liter. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ronald joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to add to his working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronald from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Meuk

texts.en:
Mrs. Meuk U., who was born in 1958, is living in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province. She is the mother of five children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the others are studying in local public schools. 

Mrs. Meuk U. and her husband, Mr. YoeU. Koem, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He also cuts leaves of palm trees to make roofs for sale. 

Mrs. Meuk U. wants to buy a new motorbike, but her savings money is not enough. So Mrs. Meuk U. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike for her family transportation. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj T., 60, is married and lives with his wife and a 6-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His son goes to kindergarden. 

They live in an apartment that they bought recently by selling their old house with the land that they had owned. 

He used to run a food store before he started operating a taxi service business using his own car in 2010. Now his taxi service business is the main source of their family income. 

Dagvadorj is an honest and modest person who says, "I want to start a new business such as operating a food store in the future besides driving a taxi." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for his car that he uses in his taxi service business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of Manil. She is 28 years old. Evangeline is married with two children. To make a living, Evangeline buys and sells fish in the local community.  Her monthly income is 15,000 PHP.

In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and  living situation. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

location.town: Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N., 41 years old, owns a small shop in front her house where she sells soft drinks, sweets, snacks, and other products. She typically makes around US $2 in profit each day to support her family. She is married to 39-year-old, Chean Phon, who is a local farmer in the Kompong Cham province. She has two children. One is employed as a sewing worker in the city of Phnom Penh, and other one attends school. 

Heng N. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Heng N. would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to expand her selling business by purchasing more essential products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa S. is 25, married and has one child. She is very persistent and entrepreneurial woman.
 
In 2001, in order to support her family, Edisa began her business of selling children’s clothes with the initial capital of 50,000 KGS. She worked hard and made every effort to develop her business. For this reason, she took three loans from Bai-Tushum and Partners, which were used as intended and repaid without any delays.  

With the revenues, she was able to expand the range of goods she sells and obtain new customers.
 
Edisa will use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden the range of products she sells. With the revenues, she plans to purchase a car for her family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom N. lives in Thmei village in Takeo province. She is married to Mr. Phak Suong and they have  two children who are too young for school. 

She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He also is a palm juice collector. 

Through they work hard, they can earn only a little income. So to improve her family income, Mrs. Sreymom N. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Four people are making a group loan. They are located in Preaek Khmaer village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chea C. was born in 1972, and she is the group leader, selected by the other members of this group.

Mrs. Chea C. is single and lives with five family members at her home. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow different vegetables for selling. Even with the farm, she still earns less than enough income to support her family members. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for food.

loans.use: To buy rice for food

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoem N., born in 1959, lives in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice and vegetables to sell in order to support her family. To support this enterprise, Nhoem is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline.

Nhoem is a widow with five children: one a laborer, one a seamstress in a garment factory, one a vegetable seller, and the other two students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline for production of rice and various vegetables.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel D. P., from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental, is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Razel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She also buys and sells ready-to-wear clothes. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Razel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 30000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her 10th loan for 30000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell including a bundle of used clothing or ukay-ukay. Razel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell including a bundle of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia T., from the village of Tabon, is 60 years old, married, and has five children. To make a living, Bonifacia operates a business venture in food production/sales. Her products include baked goods which are locally known as Biko, Puto, Putomaya, etc.

In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her seventh loan for 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for baking, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking foods.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria T., from the village of Tabon, is 57 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Gloria operates a business in the retail sector buying and selling Ready-to-Wear products in the community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 17,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her sixth loan for 12,000 PHP to add capital to her business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sann S. I. was born I. 1963. She is a widow with three children: two are iron welders and the youngest is a fisherman who supports his mother's fishing business. 
Mrs. Sann S. I. is a villager from Preaek Dach village I. Kandal province. She is a grocery seller I. the local village, and I. this way she earns a small income to support her family. Aside from this business, she also earns a living by fishing. I. order to support her fishing business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Punta. She is 45 years old and married with two school-aged children. Lilia has a store selling cosmetics. She also has a snack and peanut-butter vending business. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.
In 2008, Lilia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for her peanut butter and snack-vending business. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food-vending business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga D. is 55, married and has two grown children. She was born into a family of farmers and from early childhood had to help her parents on the farm. Olga got married, moved to her husband’s home and started to work as a builder. Later, they were able to buy a small house in Internatsionalnoe village (in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan). The couple worked hard to support their children. Unfortunately, their earnings didn’t cover all their family expenses. For this reason, Olga started a business in poultry breeding. With an initial capital of 1,800 KGS, she purchased 15 chickens and managed to earn about 2,000 KGS per month from selling eggs.
Now Olga is requesting a loan of 30,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing bull calves. This will allow her to further develop her farm.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum T. lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh Village in Takeo Province, and she was born in 1954. She and her husband, Mr. Laiy Norng, are farmers who own a 3.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables for selling to support their family. In the crop field, she has some problems because the soil in her field is infertile, it is far away from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Tum T. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, while two are farming laborers, and the fourth is attending local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
"Hardworking woman" best describes Josie R., a 26-year-old single woman who lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Despite her situation, being handicapped, Josie still lives normally. She remains strong in order to survive. That’s why she opened a “carenderia,” or small restaurant. 

The business is doing very well with hard work and God’s help. She was able to send her children to school and able to meet the needs of her family. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative when she joined the organization in June 2003. She has availed herself of several loans already. Now she is applying for a 5,000-PHP loan to buy kilos of meat and spices for her carenderia, and grocery items for her sari-sari (variety) store. She really wants to have a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To purchase meats and other ingredients for her eatery

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six people; they are located in Preaek Khmaer Village in Kandal Province.

Mrs. Yoem P. was born in 1954, and she is a group leader. She was selected as the group leader by its four members. She and her husband, Mr. Y. Thuok, are farmers who own a plot of land, which they use to grow vegetables to make a living. But they do not have enough money to support their farm. So in order to do this, Mrs. Yoem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies for growing vegetable crops. 

Mrs. Yoem P. is a widow with four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer, and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for growing vegetable crops

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married with eight adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables to local community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for house repair. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Santalat's Group

texts.en:
Santalat H. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 59 and married. Together with her husband, she has raised three daughters and two sons. Most of her children are married and employed. Santalat and her husband are pensioners; in order to earn money to cover their personal expenses they breed cattle. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future, Santalat wants to increase the number of cattle and then save enough money to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstanat http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia L. is from the village of Lalawan, Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 62 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Engracia owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Engracia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Engracia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Engracia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Engracia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for tailoring

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. is from the village of Talisay. She is 27 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Emily operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for pig fence renovation. Emily is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.

In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory. 

Marites would be happy if all her children are able to finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Kruoch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people; they are located in K'am Samnar Kraom village in Kandal province. 

Mr. Kruoch T. was born in 1980, and he is the group leader. He was selected to be the group leader by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. Kong Samrith, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice. They face a problem with the farm because they do not have enough money to grow crops. So in order to support this farm, Mr. Kruoch T. would like to ask for a loan to buy gasoline and pesticides for growing rice. Aside from farmers, they are also earning a living by milling rice at home. 

This couple has two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and pesticides

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, 69 years old, is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is married and has ten children. She owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store located at the front of her house. She sells soft drinks, eggs and other various products. Catalina works hard to improve her business and be able to provide for her family's needs. She also wants to help with her grandchildren's schooling.

Catalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh T. T. N. is 39 years old. Before joining with our credit program in 2004, she had been a farmer. But when she obtained a loan from Seda, she changed her business mind. She invested in selling birds as pets. This kind of business allows her family economy to improve. Last year, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND. Due to the higher demand of customers, she hopes to get a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy a variety of birds to meet the customer's tastes in raising birds.

loans.use: To buy a variety of birds

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong T. D. is 57 years old and has for the last seven years made a living by providing health care to pets and livestock. Her business, which has been helped by microfinance loans from our organization, is growing quickly and gives her an income of 3,500,000 VND a month. She has repaid her previous loans on time and is applying for a new one, for 8,502,000 VND, to buy equipment for her veterinary practice.

loans.use: to buy some equipment and medications for a veterinary practice

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en: This loan group has four members, all of whom live in Kokir Thum village in Kandal province. The group has chosen Mrs. Nai N., was born in 1972 and is married, as its leader. She works as a farmer and her main crop is rice. She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her work is important to her family's well-being because her husband, Mr. Yim Vibol, works at a company where he receives a very small salary. The couple has three children, all of whom are students who also work on the family farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to use on a rice farm.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Майбалиев Парвиз проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Холост. Имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии проработал три года. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу. Открыл интернет-кафе. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для приобретения мониторов.
texts.en: Parviz M. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 28 years old and single. He has a college degree in economics. He has worked in his field for three years. Now he provides  businessservices. He opened an Internet café. He has been in this line of work for two years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase computer monitors.

loans.use: Purchasing computer monitors

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam T. P. is 51 years old, has one son and lives in the hamlet of Pho Cho. She makes a living by running a small restaurant where she serves Pho, a very popular local delicacy in Vietnam. She opened her restaurant in 2003, one year before securing her first loan from our organization. She used that loan to buy a refrigerator to keep her beef fresh. Since that time, she has received six additional loans and used each effectively to expand her business. She now earns 3,000,000 VND in profit every month from her work. She is committed to continue repaying loans on time and has applied for a new one, for 8,066,000 VND, to buy the equipment she needs to improve and expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy equipment to improve and expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: This five-person loan group is made up of people who live in Kokir Thum village in Kandal province. The person chosen by the group as its leader, Mrs. Chan S., was born in 1959, and makes a living by farming a one-hectare plot of land with her husband, Mr. Pok Sakhorn. Their main crops are corn and cucumbers, and she will use her portion of this loan to buy more seeds to plant. The couple has five children: one is a farmer, two are laborers, and the other three are students.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and cucumber seeds for a small farm.

loans.name: Sinh

texts.en: Sinh T.  V. is 58 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are married. She makes a living by running a small restaurant where she makes and serves breakfast. She started this business in 2004, after securing her first microfinance loan from our organization. Her business is doing well, and she is applying for a new loan, for 6,233,000 VND to buy the equipment she needs to expand her restaurant and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. N., a 52-year-old woman with two children living in the hamlet of Phocho, has been a member of our credit program since 2004 when she borrowed 1,425,000 VND to open a small  restaurant that serves breakfast.  Her business has developed well, creating a stable income for her to manage the expenses of her family.   Since the beginning of her participation in our credit program, Hoa has always met her repayment schedules, and is now requesting a loan of 7,630,000 VND to expand her business activity.

loans.use: To expand her business activity

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be T. N. is 62 years old with 3 children. Two of her children have their own families. Be T. N. is providing for a vocational training course for driving for the last son.

Ms. Be has a small restaurant that serves lunch for workers at some nearby workshops. She started her business in 2004 and it developed more when she  borrowed  loans from SeDa credit program.  She is always a good re-payer during  her participation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy more sets of tables and desks to make more seats to meet the demands of customers.

loans.use: To buy more sets of tables and desks to make more seats.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people; they are located in Kokir Thum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ton L. was born in 1950, and was selected by the group members to be the group leader. The members of this group hope to use their loans to increase their income and improve their families' living. 

Mrs. Ton L. is single, and she is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow sugar cane for her living. In order to support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to support her farming crops.

loans.use: To support her farming crops.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa T. N. is 35 years old with 2 children. She lives with her family in Coaloa commune.

She has a shop that sells blankets, carpets, and mats  in the local market.  Her business is quite good, and creates 80,000 VND profit per day. Being a client of Seda Credit program since 2004, she has received 6 loans and has used them effectively in expanding business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy more kinds of carpets with new designs to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of carpets with new designs to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai T. T. D. is 43 years old. She has sold trees and birds for 6 years, after she received first loan in 2004. Her business is quite good because she sells them at home and at the local market when it is open.

Being a client of Seda credit program for 7 years, she has always been in a good repayment situation. Last year, she got a loan of 5,886,000 VND. To buy more birds and trees, she hopes to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND.

loans.use: To buy more birds and trees.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. N. is 37 years old with 1 child.  Being a farmer, her main activity is growing rice and vegetables to sell wholesale. Every day, she can get 80,000 VND profit from her sales. Joining the credit program in 2004, she has received 8 loans and invested effectively in expanding her farming.

Currently, she wants to buy more kinds of vegetables with high productivity to prepare for the next crop, as well as fertilizer. Therefore, she wishes to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to put her plans into practice.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people. They are located in Ta Koch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pech T., born in 1946, was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

She is a widow and lives with five family members at her home. Three of them are earning to supporting the family members. With these businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. 

So, in order to increase the income to improve the family’s conditions, Mrs. Pech T. wants to start a new business. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase sewing supplies to support her new business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies to support her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To develop her husband's business and make more money.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna makes artificial flowers to share the financial burdens of her family. She lives in a combined family system and is married to M. A. who works in a private organization. Her two brother-in-laws also live with Lubna and her family. One of them is a tailor master and the other works in a factory for a low income.

Lubna is a mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is studying in class 1 and younger one is only 2 years old. She lives in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city. Her home is made of bricks and is located in the area of Green town. She came here 8 years ago. She is a very supportive lady and tries to minimize her cost of living so that her children can continue their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who wants to buy a new sewing machine. He will also hire a worker who will assist him in completing the orders on time.
