About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring supplies such as needles and thread

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is a young man from Qalqilia. He is married and has no children yet. Subhi works in the agriculture industry. He has contracts with a number of farmers in Qalqilia to transfer their crops to the shops around the town. Subhi started this job one year ago and it is helping him secure a good life for his small family.

Subhi took a loan from FATEN to pay for the last payment of the vehicle he uses to transfer the crops of farmers. The previous owner agreed on dividing the payments on a monthly basis. The loan will be used to cover the last payment.

Subhi appears in the picture here.

loans.use: To make the last payment on a small freight vehicle

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Rita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Romchek

texts.en:
Mrs. Romchek K. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Hon Hok, live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have seven children, including three sons and four daughters. Two of them are married and the other three attend school. 
Romchek sells vegetable and corn. She buys them under contract from the fellow villagers and when harvest season come, she transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a homebuilder. She is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables and corn for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and corn for resale

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey P. is a 51 year-old villager in Samraong village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder who earns money to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Ong, is a chef who also earns money to support his family. Although they work hard, they earn a small income. So to improve her income, Mrs. Srey P. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the other one is a seamstress in garment factory, and the youngest one is attending local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol A. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Sol is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sol owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing habal-habal (modified motorcycle) transit services to local community members. Sol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Sol is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of motorcycle for service

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambo K. (pictured) is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Yot Po is 46 years old. They have been married since 1983 and have three children, including two sons and one daughter. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sambo is a weaver. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn V. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 41 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 children aged 21, 20 and 13. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Marilyn works hard to sustain her children's education.

Marilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is currently in a business of selling alcohol, tea and charcoal. She is 35 years old, divorced, with 4 children who all go to school. Ayuba wishes to use her loan to stock more alcohol, tea and charcoal. With extra profits, Ayuba hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: Stock more tea, alcohol and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Ryanteretere Twekambe Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: 45 year-old A. Aron has a food sales business at a food market stall in Bushenyi. She has been operating this business for the last 5 years. The happily married mother of 4 has mostly been selling staple foods such as bananas, cassava and rice. This business brings in shillings 90,000 per week. She is requesting this loan to purchase more bananas and rice for resale.

loans.use: The purchase more bananas and rice for resale

loans.name: Jocinter Auma

texts.en:
Jocinter Auma is a 32-year-old modest woman from Kisumu city and is married to Mike Juma, a businessman. They have three children aged 2, 5 and 12 years old.

Jocinter operates a baking business, preparing mandazi, a traditional donut-like breakfast food taken together with tea. She has been operating this business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. Jocinter is taking out her first loan, which she will use to purchase baking flour, cooking oil and other ingredients. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock and to provide for her family's basic needs. Jocinter's dream is to build her own residential house just to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 44 years old and married. She has 5 children aged 24, 22, 20, 11 and 8. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Isabel's husband is a fisherman who also works hard to provide for their family's needs.

Isabel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 40 years old, divorced, with 3 children (2 of which go to school). Keji's loan will be used to stock more alcohol for sale. In the future, Keji hopes to pay school fees for her children with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more cash crops for resale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina T. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 50 years old. Rufina is married and has 7 children.  Her husband is a fisherman and she sells his catch. She also buys directly from fishermen to get a lower price. She then goes around her community to sell fish. Rufina works hard to improve her business and improve her earnings. 

Rufina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rufina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario C. is from the town of Tagbilaran. He is 51 years old and married. To make a living, Dario owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Dario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dario has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Dorjgotov

texts.en: Dorjgotov, 41, is married and lives with his wife and seven children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own on the outskirts of the city. Five of his children attend a local school and his wife helps him with his business. In 2005 he began making traditional Mongolian boots at home which he supplies to a local monastery. The cost to make a pair of boots is 47,150 MNT and he sells them for 75,000 MNT to the monastery. He makes seven boots every ten days and his monthly profit is between 300,000-400,000 MNT. He is a very hardworking and intelligent man who takes care of his large family. Dorjgotov says, "My wish is to raise my seven children as well-educated people with the hope that they will make a positive contribution to our country's prosperity in the future". He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials for his boot manufacturing business since he has been receiving a large amount of orders.

loans.use: To purchase boot manufacturing materials

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani belongs to Okara which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Tariq colony with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here 10 years ago. She is 33 years old, married to M. A. who is an electrician by profession. His shop is located in the community area and he offers quality electrical repair services to his customers. 

Rani is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. 2 of them are enrolled in a local high school and getting their education while youngest one is only 5 years old and has not started his education yet. Rani is a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighboring clients. She charges $2 per cloth and the earning helps her to pay for her children school fee.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy the latest repair tools which will help him to perform better services for his customers. 

Rani is very hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy repair tools

loans.name: Munhnaran

texts.en: Munhnaran, 26, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living and they live in a house that they own in her sister's backyard. Her two children go to kindergarden. Munhnaran has worked as a knitter for a company between 2009 and 2010. Then she began to make clothes at home in 2010. Now she is operating a knitting and clothing manufacturing business in her home. She wants to expand her business and have her own workshop. She hopes to hire unemployed people to offer them a chance as well. She is an honest and modest person who says, "I would like to expand my current business and make more profit in order to save money for my sons' future education. I want them to go to college and get good education". Munhnaran is requesting a loan of 900,000 MNT to purchase materials for her clothing sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing business

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto T. is from the town of Tagbilaran. He is 45 years old. Antonieto is married and has 4 children aged 15, 14, 11 and 5. To make a living, Antonieto owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Antonieto works hard to sustain his children's education.

Antonieto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonieto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Antonieto is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Partrick  Irungu

texts.en:
Partrick Irungu W., 37 years old, is married to Cecilia who is a business lady. They have three school-going children.  He has been in the "Matatu" (public transport) business for five years and earns a profit of Kshs. 30,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing group, and he is applying for his first loan to repair and service the vehicle. His "Matatu" operates in Ruai on a route that is in a peri-urban area and well populated.

The profit will be ploughed back into business and in future he looks forward to growing his business and starting a company. He is a very honest and hard-working gentleman.

loans.use: To repair and service the van

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen C. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 32 years old. Marijen is married and has 5 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marijen owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Marijen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

Marijen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marijen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment such as hooks & nets

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 33, is married and lives with her husband and their four-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house in her father's backyard.  Her husband makes horse saddles from home and her son goes to kindergarten. They have a decent standard of living. 

Oyunchimeg began her business venture by operating a bakery shop from 2000 to 2003. Then she started a seamstress business, which she has been running for the past 5 years. Oyunchimeg and her husband both fill custom orders for traditional clothing as well as items such as deel – a traditional Mongolian long coat, and horse saddles. They sell women's deels for 65,000 MNT, which cost them 30,000 MNT to produce. Men's deels are sold for 80,000 MNT and cost 40,000 MNT to produce. Their monthly profit is between 400,000 to 500,000 MNT.  

Oyunchimeg is a hardworking and active person who tries her best to fulfill her goals. Oyunchimeg says, "We get loans from XasBank and it has already helped us to improve our lives". She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase more materials for her deel making business.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios H. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 68 years old. Remedios is married and has 5 children. 

To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

Remedios joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.   Remedios is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Kurash

texts.en:
Kurash O. is 30 years old. He is married and a father of four children aged between five and fifteen. Kurash is a farmer,  farming his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five  years.

He learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be his  third  loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm.Because of the climatic condition and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers.

Kurash hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Kurash's dream is do large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery.  He is a painstaking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for wheat farm

loans.name: Noel

texts.fr:
Homme de 49 ans célibataire et père  de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 ans et 22 ans, ils sont tous scolarisés. 
Il  se lança dans la vente de quincaillerie , il ouvrit un étalage  en 2000 avec un capital de 50000frs. Bénéficiaire d'un prêt il y a de cela quatre mois, il a rembourse sans difficulté et a fait des épargnes considérables. 
Avec ce second ce prêt il aimerait renforcer son activité en achetant des carreaux, ampoules de tous genre, pinceaux, des robinets, prises et contacts pour l'électricité et autres matériaux de construction. 
Il  à pour stratégie d'épargner toutes les semaines, d'améliorer son étalage  afin de mieux garder sa clientèle. 
Il  aimerait que son activité prospère de jour au jour  afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et a l'avenir ouvrir une grande quincaillerie et aller acheter les pièces a l'étranger.
texts.en: He is a single 49-year-old man and the father of 4 children, who range in age from 6 to 22, and who are all educated.  He started off in the sale of hardware, and opened a stall in 2000 with a starting capital of 50,000 frs.  The recipient of a loan about 4 months ago, he has repaid it without any difficulty and has made considerable savings.  With this second loan, he would like to strengthen his business by buying tiles, bulbs of all varieties, brushes, sinks, outlets and ignitions for electricity, as well as other constuction materials.  As a strategy to save each week, he will improve his stall in order to keep his customer base.  He would like his business to prosper from day to day, in order to improve his family's living conditions, and in the future he would like to open a large hardware store and go buy materials abroad.

loans.use: Purchase of electrical wires, lightbulbs, sinks of all varieties, plumbing materials

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mr. Yi C. lives in Prey Prum village in Takeo province. He was born in 1966. He owns an agricultural machine and is a speaker repairman.  His wife, Mrs. Hey Cheng, is a farmer who rents a piece of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

In the rice field, he has problems because the land has infertile soil, is far away from the irrigation system, and has a lot of insects. To improve his rice production, Mr. Yi C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.  With the rest of the loan, he will also buy five tables to rent out to the villagers. 

Mr. Yi C. is a father of three children – one is a seamstress in garment factory, and the others are enrolled in the local public school. 

His wife is shown the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and tables to rent out

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. 

Shaymaa has been a seamstress for a long time. In 2008, she opened her own sewing business for women and baby clothes. She is well known in her local area and has an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a sewing machine and a generator. She is planning to expand her business and open her own sewing factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and a generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase food for restaurant and buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has four children.

Raed is a carpenter. He has worked in this field for a long time. In 2009, he decided to open his own carpentry shop and work on his own. He is well known in his local community and has a good reputation.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to buy a big generator so his production will be continuous in case of electricity cuts. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and develop his skills.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the small colony called Tariq. 

Mumtaz is 43 years old.  She is married to S. A., who is an embroidery expert. His shop is located in the market where he offers his clients his embroidery skills. He makes embroidery by hand and also with an embroidery machine. He crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which help attract more customers to his shop.  

Mumtaz is also very good in embroidery. She offers services to her community clients. She started this business 10 years ago to financially support her family and it is working well for her.  She is also a very good administrator – she manages her household expenses very well and fulfills her household work effectively. 

Mumtaz has given birth to 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. Her eldest son works in a private factory and her elder daughter helps her in the embroidery business.  Only one of her children is able to get education. He is 12 years old and is studying in the 5th class.

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase an embroidery machine to  help her finish orders on time and produce quality work.  She hopes her business will further improve after the loan investment.

Mumtaz is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that this will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy an embroider machine for embroidery business

loans.name: Mrs. Samom Chem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people who live in A Cheang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Samom C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members in the group.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Samom C. sells corn door-to-door to earn income to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Chenda Yien, sells recycled materials. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand.  To improve her business, Mrs. Samom C. is asking for a loan to buy more corn to resell and and  more recycle materials to trade. 

Mrs. Samom C. is a mother of three children – one is enrolled in the local public school, and the others are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy corn to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of BB drinks

loans.name: Sarah Wambui

texts.en:
Sarah has been selling clothes in Olkalou town for the last nine years.  She is 44 years old, married to Benson K., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy school uniforms and women's clothing for resale.

In future, Sarah hopes to grow her clothing business into a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Sabore Ole

texts.en:
Sabore Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married and a father of four school-going children. Sabore is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan which he is planning to use on his farm to prepare it and buy farm inputs. The farm being located along the main road makes it easy for him to get customers for his maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm to increase his maize production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize for commercial purpose. Sabore is a hardworking man and determined to reach his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ntelia Sanaeta

texts.en:
Ntelia Sanaeta O. K. is 37 years old, married, and a father of three school-going children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.


He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan. He is planning to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize output and use some part of the profit to develop his plot.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize on a  large scale. Ntelia is assiduous and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure to improve agricultural production

loans.name: Noelly Natacha

texts.fr:
Noelly Natacha est une commerçante de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10 mois et 18 ans.
A l’arrêt de ses études après le bac en 1999,  elle se lance dans la vente des layettes pour bébé, des brassières, des couches, des biberons, couvertures, des draps et tous ce que les femmes utilisent pour leurs nouveaux nés.
A l’octroi de ce prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en achetant  10 douzaines de couches, 10 douzaines de brassières, des lots de biberons, des séries des draps et couvertures.
Très courageuse, elle a l’ambition d’ouvrir un magasin de layette, épargner et faire des gros bénéfices  pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Noelly Natacha is a 36-year-old single woman and the mother of 3 children whose ages vary between 10 months and 18 years old. 

When she stopped studying after getting her high school diploma in 1999, she started selling baby clothes. She sells underwear, baby pants, diapers, undershirts, blouses, baby boots, feeding-bottles and all other items that women need for their newborn babies.

With this loan she plans to buy more merchandise to sell, namely 10 dozen diapers, 10 dozen brassieres, stocks of bottles, sets of sheets, and blankets.

A courageous woman, she hopes to open a baby clothes shop, save and earn large profits in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Dozens of undershirts, baby pants, sheets, knitwear and baby-boots

loans.name: Josephine Gatogo

texts.en:
Josephine has practised mixed farming in Olkalou town for the last five years.  She is 33 years old, married to Joseph Maina Mwaniki, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She has repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow, fertilier and maize seeds for planting.

In future, Josephine hopes to build rental houses so as to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and maize seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children’s outfits, dresses, pants, jeans

loans.name: Lateefa

texts.en:
Lateefa is a mother of two daughters and two sons. Lateefa and her husband started a small grocery store two years ago. The store is giving the family decent returns. Lateefa took a loan from FATEN to purchase more variety of goods to enrich the grocery store and attract more clients.

Lateefa's children are still very young, but she wants to enlarge the business and be able to save enough to secure her children's education money for the near future.

Lateefa's husband appears in the picture here, as Lateefa is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods for their store

loans.name: Javharjon

texts.en:
Javharjon is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is a vegetable farmer, something he has done for the past 9 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes the most. For Javharjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Javharjon also raises cattle.  His family helps him with his businesses. 

Javharjon wishes to borrow money to purchase seeds, fertilizers, fuels and lubricants, in order to grow seasonal vegetables. This is his fourth loan from IMON International.  He promises to repay the current loan without any violation and thanks all lenders for their support.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds mineral fertilizers, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.en:
F. Najmidin lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is 48 years old, married and has five children. Najmidin is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows at the local market. Once every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers, raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows to local butchers. Today, Najmidin is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Nanyingae Ene

texts.en:
Nanyingae Ene N.  is 24 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She farms on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last five years.

She learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her third loan, after successfully paying back her previous loans well and on time. She will use the entire loan amount to  buy seeds  and pay for labour. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.


Her hope and dream is to become a great farmer. Nanyingae is an energetic and active woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labour

loans.name: Mirjamol

texts.en:
M. Mirjamol is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Mirjamol has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mirjamol harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. With these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Mirjamol requests 7,500 Somoni for purchasing young cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en:
Abdumajid is a hard-working taxi driver from Khujand, Tajikistan. For the last 20 years, he has driven thousands of kilometers transporting passengers all around the city and at times around the country. Abdumajid started as a taxi driver because he was unable to find another good job. He makes about $15 in a typical day, which is enough to support himself, his wife and two children. Abdumajid has requested a loan of $1,000 USD to make some repairs to his car engine. One of the drawbacks to being a taxi driver is the potential for costly repair overhead.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Sulton has worked in agriculture, raising livestock. He raises cattle which he cares for greatly.  Thanks to his herd, he can cover his household expenses. Sulton showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against  various diseases. For Sulton, it is very important to work  and raise his animals, so he is currently seeking a loan  to purchase additional cattle so that in future he can earn more money. We appreciate your support for Sulton’s projects.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Look To God Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Look To God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adama K., 40, is the leader of this group. She is married to a businessman and they have two children who are attending primary school. Adama has been a businesswoman for 15 years. She sells rice, beans, bananas, and any other food items that she can lay hands on. With her share of this loan, Adama will buy food in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy food in greater quantities

loans.name: Oriku Charles

texts.en:
Oriku Charles K. is 24 years old. He supports four people in the family. He is a farmer and he farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his third loan from KADET and he is planning to prepare his maize farm. Maize does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He plans to re-invest the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan in the farm and plant more acres of maize. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in maize and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a meticulous man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare his maize farm

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 53-year-old, married man who lives with his wife and three children in Jericho. In 2000, Fares opened his own flower shop in which he sells flowers and pots. He is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy new plants and pots for his store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to be able to buy new plants and pots for his store

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur H. was born in Azerbaijan in 1985. When Artur was one year old his father died, and Artur’s mother decided to move from Azerbaijan to Armenia with her two children. They bought a house in Aygehovit village, in the Ijevan area. Artur and his sister graduated from the high school in the same village. 

Artur and his mother do animal breeding and land cultivation. They breed cows and produce cheese on their farm. Artur sells milk and cheese in Ijevan city’s market and so provides for his family.

Artur needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his cows.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fodder for his cows

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba O. L. is 30 years old. He is married and a father of children. Kumba is a farmer and he farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan, after successfully paying back his previous loans well and on time. He plans to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his fifteen acres of maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize output and use some part of the profit to develop his plot.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize on a large scale. Kumba is hard-working and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his fifteen acres of maize

loans.name: Dadoboy

texts.en:
E. Dadoboy is 58 years old and has one child. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Dadoboy started his business 20 years ago. He has a lot of experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from a young age. 

Dadoboy would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

loans.use: To buy more calves to expand the business

loans.name: Fet Shameness Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Fet Shameness” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 400,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mabinty K. is the leader of this group. The thirty year old is a widow with three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mabinty has been a businesswoman since 1991. She sells firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy firewood in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy firewood in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
M. Abdusamat is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has three children and a wife to support. He wants to develop his business of raising cattle in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from surrounding towns. Abdusamat is helped by his wife. 

He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing; accordingly, their expenses are growing, too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities along with the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
