To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Nebasfeh

texts.en:
G. is married with two children. With a heavy responsibility on him as a husband to provide for his children and those of his family, he decided to become a GHAPE member. As a member he can obtain a loan and start up a business to raise money, to assist his wife, to pay school fees and to provide food for his children.

He was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, and since then has shown a commitment to investing and repaying his loans. Given this loan, he plans to buy planks for furniture, and day old chicks. His business is very lucrative because he is in the commercial zone where he will always have customers. 

He plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business and buy food for his family. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: day old chicks and planks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Redecorate the shop, buy an air conditioner and increase inventory

loans.name: Nurbek

texts.en:
Nurbek M. is a 50-year-old farmer who lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  He was born and grew up in a family of farmers in Tajikistan. He got married at the age of 19 and soon became the father of three sons. In 2003, Nurbek and his family moved to Kyrgyzstan and bought a house in Belovodskoe village. In order to find a means of subsistence for his family, Nurbek started his business of cattle breeding and land cultivating. With the initial capital of 10,000 KGS, he managed to earn about $150 in a month through selling tomatoes and meat products. 

Nurbek works hard to make this business successful and now plans to develop it with the help of a loan of 50,000 KGS. With the revenue from this investment, Nurbek wants to help his elder son in purchasing a house. In the future, his family plans to enlarge their number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tawopaneh Group" from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu K.. She was born in the village of Masanga in northern Sierra Leone 27 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells medicines and clothes. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. With her share of this loan she will buy more medicines and clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Veronica N. is married to Solomon and is the mother of five children. The loss of her children is what she most hates to think about. 

As an ambitious woman, she decided to put all the effort she can to see her remaining children established in good vocations in life. Because of the ill health of her husband, she was not able to pay school fees for her children, so they all exceeded the primary school age. Therefore, the only option for them was to drop out of school and stay in the house for a few years before continuing with their education.

Veronica has sought help from GHAPE to operate a business and to pay her children's school fees. Given this loan, she plans to cultivate crops like yams and to sell some foodstuff. She will use the profits to pay school fees and buy medications for her husband.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To clear and till the soil and plant yams to sell

loans.name: Joseph Kariuki

texts.en: Joseph has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. He is 50 years old, married to Rose Ntheya and they have two children. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our staff and this will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Joseph plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting. In the future, Joseph hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting

loans.name: Wafika

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. 

Wafika is farmer and she has owned a cow farm since 2000. The main products are dairy items. She is well known in her local area and has good reputation.

She is requesting a $1200 loan to buy a cow so she will be able to increase her productivity and grow her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Stephen Nderu

texts.en: Stephen has practised mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 40 years old, married to Jane Wangui and they have four children. Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Stephen plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Stephen hopes to embrace technology in his farming methods to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Amude

texts.en: Amude is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 35 years old and a widow. She has seven children and four of them go to school. She is taking out a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. Amude hopes to build a house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “MENA Group" from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to ask for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Fatmata K.. She was born in 1967 in the northern city of Makeni. She is married and has six children. Her husband is retired and sick at home, and two of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Fatmata sells firewood, rice, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), cigarettes, etc. She has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, onions, margi, cigarettes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Geofrey Muiruri

texts.en:
Geofrey, 27 years old, has practiced farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He does both farming and dairy.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid for his first loan of Kshs 27,000 well and in good time.  He plans to buy a dairy cow with the loan amount.

In the future, Geofrey hopes to become a leading farmer in Nduyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ndeh

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Ndeh P. is married with four children. He has faced a lot of challenges, the worst being the death of his brother and father.

Given the need to carry the burden as a father to educate and feed his children, He became a member of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. He has been able to manage loans now for nine years which has greatly improved his living standard. Given this loan he plans to buy and fatten chickens and sell them. He also plans to sell three-week-old chicks he produces in the community and use the chicken droppings as manure on his farm.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Joyce has a boutique, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell in the boutique. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in her boutique

loans.name: Peter Kamau

texts.en: Peter has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last eight years. He is 32 years old, married to Elizabeth Nyawira and they have four children. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy goat. In the future, Peter hopes to practise mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy a dairy  goat

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sabenty” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is twenty-eight-year-old and married with two children who are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells medicines and has been doing this business for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying medicines such as Paracetamol, Stop Aches, ORS, Flagins, and syrups to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy medicines such as Paracetamol and syrups to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
Born in l958, M. is married with four children. He has very little education because his parents were poor and there was nobody to support him to further his education. He joined GHAPE in 1999. He has proven beyond doubt his ability to receive, invest, repay loans, and provide quality goods including piglets, manure and food crops to his community.

M. has gained from the many people within GHAPE and his immediate environment mainly because of his leadership qualities demonstrated at all levels. His desire is to provide steady transportation services and keep up with customers demand. Given this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle, pay the registration and obtained all required official documents. Since the roads are not in good conditions and transport vehicles hardly travel this road regularly. Motorcycles are the only alternatives to transport people and luggage. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: motorcycle and papers

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat D. was born in 1974 in Gandzakar villagelocated in the area of Ijevan.  Ararat and his father are engaging in animal breeding and land cultivation. In their farm they rear cows and calves, and raise barley, which they use as a fodder for their farm animals  He sells dairy products from their farm at the Ijevan market to support his family. 

Ararat says that on their farm they get a lot of leftover byproduct from the whey they produce, so he decided to buy some pigs which will eat this whey. He asks for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some pigs and to buy some fodder, because he didn't sow barley last year.

loans.use: To buy some pigs and  fodder

loans.name: Yuh

texts.en:
Yuh G. is a 38 year old married woman blessed with six children. She shares three rooms with her six children in Ghana Street, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

G. has faced difficulties in her life ranging from the  inability to meet up with her daily needs and the increasing demands of my children. Amongst other challenges, she also has had difficulties of inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to buy more cloth and thread. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly with many clients. Her activity will help her business by reducing the cost of transportation.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist my husband in providing for the children’s school needs, meet up with her personal needs and feed her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, the moral support given her by the GHAPE office and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Soad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 31 years old, a single woman who lives with one parent.

Soad learned to be a seamstress, so in 2008 she opened her own sewing project for women's and baby clothes. She is well known in her local area and has an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a $1400 loan to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator. She is aiming to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Nangah

texts.en:
Center;   CO 6              	

Nangah M. was born in 25/8/1971 and is blessed with five children. She shares four rooms with her four children in Nstualam, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

M. has faced difficulties in her life ranging from the inability to meet up with her daily needs and the increasing demands of her children. Among other challenges, she also has had difficulties of inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to buy food stuff like beans, rice, tomato, onion, garlic, maggi, corn, groundnuts, sugar and cassava flakes commonly known as garri. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is close to the road and she is friendly with many clients. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her business in reducing cost of transportation.

She will use a fraction of her profit to assist my husband provide for the children’s school needs, meet up with my personal needs and feed my family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy beans, corn and groundnuts

loans.name: Daniel Mbugua

texts.en: Daniel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. He is 30 years old, married to Jecinta Muthoni and they have one child. Daniel was introduced to KADET by one of the field staff and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. Daniel plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his farming, hence increase his farm production.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María pertenece al Banco comunal “Vida Nueva”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Longaví. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de disfraces para fiestas, desde hace 15 años.  María compra sus materiales en la ciudad de Linares y en Santiago, su material de trabajo es principalmente ropa usada la que  remodela, para obtener novedosos diseños de disfraces. Además tiene un bazar en el cual vende sus disfraces. Su hija le ayuda en la venta de disfraces dentro del bazar.
María tiene clientes frecuentes particulares y un colegio, al cual vende disfraces para fiestas escolares.
Con este préstamo, pretende comprar disfraces para fiestas en tallas más grandes.
Su sueño es aumentar el número de clientes, incluidos los colegios, y de esta manera aumentar su producción. Además quiere aprender a coser y comprarse una maquina de coser y una de bordar. Su motivación es aumentar la producción de disfraces, y abastecer a todo Longaví con sus productos y de esta manera agrandar su negocio.
Para María la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental en su negocio, ya que le ha permitido financiar y conocer mas de su negocio a nivel comercial y de gestión. Gracias a los ingresos de su negocio María ha podido financiar  los estudios superiores de su hija.
Longaví es una comuna de la región del Maule, zona central de Chile. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa “cabeza de serpiente”. Es una comuna eminentemente rural, agrícola, emplazada entre montañas, precordillera  y cordillera, de gran belleza natural, siendo su punto más alto el cerro Nevados de Longaví, con 3.242 metros de altitud.
texts.en:
María belongs to the Communal Bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life), which is in the city of Longaví. She has been producing and selling party dresses for fifteen years. María buys her materials in the cities of Linares and Santiago. Her work material consists primarily of used garments that she repurposes into new designs of gowns. She also has a bazaar where she sells the dresses. Her daughter helps with selling dresses in the bazaar.

María has many regular customers, including schools, which purchase dresses for school functions. With this loan, she plans to buy party dresses in larger sizes.

Her dream is to increase the number of customers, including schools, which she serves. This requires that she increase her production. In addition, she wants to learn how to sew and purchase both a sewing machine and an embroidery machine so that she can expand her business.

For María, the assistance from Fondo Esperanza has been essential to her business. It has enabled her to finance her business and learn more how to manage it. Thanks to her earnings, María has been able to fund her daughter’s higher education.

Longaví is a commune in the region of Maule in central Chile. Its name in the Mapuche language means “head of the serpent”. This is predominantly a rural farming area situated in the foothills between two mountains of great natural beauty. The highest point of Longaví is the snowy peak that stands 3,242 meters above sea level.

loans.use: Acquire party dresses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currrently in a business of selling alcohol. She is 27 years old and married to a policeman They have 3 children and 2 go to school. Rose hopes to buy a plot of land with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock more alcohol beverages to sell.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children. 

In 2009, Amjad opened his own business changing cars’ oil. He sells a wide variety of types of oil and he works at changing the oil, too. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to extend his shop. He is planning to grow and develop his work.

loans.use: Extend his shop

loans.name: Neh

texts.en:
Neh was born in 1957 and is married and a mother of six children. Her challenges have been those of illness, marital misunderstanding, and the destruction of her property during political uproar. Her husband’s unemployment has also made it difficult to feed her family well and for her children to go to school. This led her to seek help and to become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all her loans. She raised money to pay school fees for her children, buy a plot of land, build a house, and buy food for her family.

Given a loan of 400,000 FRS she plans to carry out the business of patching and selling tyres and engine oil together with crop cultivation.  Her son who has experience in that area will do the work and the workshop will be situated along the main road to access as many clients as possible. With this, she will raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees, buy medication and to complete her house.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: tyres and spare parts

loans.name: Bedan Kimingi

texts.en:
Bedan, 59 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  He mainly plants potatoes in his farm.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount for planting during the planting season. 

In future, Bedan hopes to increase his farming, hence the produce.

loans.use: To use in planting

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  He is 45 years old, married to Hannah Ngendo, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow his retail shop and stock different kinds of products.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk

loans.name: Nicholas Kolian

texts.en:
Nicholas Kolian N. is 24 years old. He is married and a father of four children. Nicholas is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last two years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare six acres for wheat planting which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.


Nicholas' hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to prepare six acres of land  for wheat planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Sikinan

texts.en:
Sikinan E. is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of four school-going children. Sikinan is a farmer and she farms her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her third loan. She is planning to spend the loan amount to buy seeds  and employ help in planting her piece of land. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can plant more wheat on a large scale.Sikinan is diligent and with the right resources at her disposal, she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds  and employ someone to help in planting her piece of land

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. 

In 2005, Ali opened his own business so he could improve his family’s quality of life. He opened a automobile electrical parts store since he had former experience in this field. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $1000 loan to install a shutter for his store. He is working on developing his business.

loans.use: Install a shutter for the store

loans.name: Sitar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has  three children. 

In 2005, Sitar opened his own business so he could improve his family’s quality of life. He opened an electrical goods’ store since he had former experience in this field. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his store and expand his inventory. He is working on developing his business.

loans.use: Renovate the store and expand inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Elizabeth ; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, la socia distribuye a la ciudad de Lima y también trabaja como docente del nivel primario en un colegio en el distrito de Maras, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.  

She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Elizabeth divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling corn.  She distributes her products in the city of Lima and also works as a teacher at the elementary level at a school in the District of Maras.  Elizabeth wants to improve her business of selling corn, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy more corn in bulk.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Mburukuja Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se llama Mburukuja y se encuentra en su décimo-primer ciclo.
La Sra. Fernanda F. de 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y vende ropas o las distribuye en las tiendas de la ciudad de Asunción y en otras localidades cercanas; lo realiza en horas de la tarde  y regresa a su casa ya cuando oscurece.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y valiente porque lucha día a día para poder salir adelante con sus hijos.
Lo que anhela es tener su propio local. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de sus dos hijos, que estudian.
texts.en:
This existing committee is called “Mburukuja” and in its eleventh loan cycle.

Sra. Fernanda F. is 59 years old and has two children. She sells clothing and distributes them to stores in the city of Asunción and other locations nearby. Fernanda performs her work in the afternoons and returns home after dark. She is a hardworking and courageous woman who struggles day after day so that she and her children can move forward. Her greatest wish is to have her own store. This will allow her to provide for her household expenses and support her two children who are in school.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons, ribbons, elastic, and other materials for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerveza y también se dedica a trabajar como docente del nivel primario en el distrito de Yucay, la socia por medio de este negocio y trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  cerveza al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, married, and has four children. Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beer. She also works as a teacher at the elementary level at a school in the District of Yucay. With this business, she is able to work so that her children can get ahead. Rosa wants to expand and improve her business of selling beer, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy beer in mass quantity.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase beer in mass quantity

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.es:
Orlanda pertenece al Banco comunal “Vida Nueva”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Longaví. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa de todo tipo: vestidos, poleras y pantalones. Orlanda trabaja en el rubro desde hace 30 años.
En temporadas de colegio tiene 5 clientes frecuentes en los que destaca colegios y Jardines Infantiles, para los que  confecciona uniformes escolares. En Fiestas Patrias (Fiesta costumbrista de Chile), confecciona ropa de huaso y huasa, en la cual se destaca la confección de vestidos floreados, faldas, blusas, en la mujer y camisa, pantalón y chaqueta en el hombre. Durante esta fecha sus principales clientes son  a los mismos colegios y particulares.
Orlanda compra sus materiales en la ciudad de Linares y en Santiago, su material de trabajo es principalmente telas e hilos. 
Su casa es su lugar de trabajo, a la cual recurren todos sus clientes en diferentes temporadas del año. Cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para realizar sus confecciones.
Con este préstamo, pretende comprar telas, botones, cierres e hilos, para aumentar la producción y generar más clientela e ingresos.
Su sueño es aumentar su producción y agrandar el negocio. 
Para Orlanda la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental en su negocio, ya que le ha permitido financiar y organizar su negocio. 
Longaví es una comuna de la región del Maule, zona central de Chile. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa “cabeza de serpiente”. Es una comuna eminentemente rural, agrícola, emplazada entre montañas, precordillera  y cordillera, de gran belleza natural, siendo su punto más alto el cerro Nevados de Longaví, con 3.242 metros de altitud.
texts.en:
Orlanda belongs to the Communal Bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life), which is in the city of Longaví. She produces clothes of all types such as dresses, shirts, and trousers. Orlanda has performed this type of work for thirty years.

During the school year, she has five regular customers consisting of high schools and nursery schools for which she produces school uniforms. For the patron saint festivals (those held in Chile include costume parties), Orlanda makes cowboy and cowgirl outfits. These include floral dresses, skirts, and blouses for women, and trousers and jackets for men. During the rest of the year, her main customers are these same schools and individuals.

Orlanda buys her materials in the cities of Linares and Santiago. The supplies she uses for her work are primarily fabrics and thread. She performs her work at home. Her customers rely on her at various times throughout the year. With the help of her daughter, she is able to complete her work. Orlanda will use this loan to buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, and thread to increase her production, attract more customers, and generate more income.

Her dream is to increase production and expand her business. For Orlanda, the assistance from Fondo Esperanza has been essential in helping her to finance and organize her business.

Longaví is a commune in the region of Maule in central Chile. Its name in the Mapuche language means “head of the serpent”. This is predominantly a rural farming area situated in the foothills between two mountains of great natural beauty. The highest point of Longaví is the snowy peak that stands 3,242 meters above sea level.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, buttons, zippers, and thread

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de profesora en el distrito de Maras, la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar e su trabajo como profesora estudiando y aprendiendo mas y de esta manera enseñar a sus alumnos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, single, and has one child. Alejandra divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a teacher in the District of Maras. Through her work, her child has the chance to get ahead. Alejandra wants to improve in her job as a teacher by studying and learning more so that she can teach her students. She is requesting a loan for personal use.

Alejandra is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es:
Roxana  tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera  y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos, en el caserío Pedregal bajo, una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, los cuales cría en un  ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad solventa sus gastos económicos personales y ayuda a sus padres en lo que necesitan.

Roxana desea ampliar su negocio comprando alimento balanceado para su ganado de modo que puedan aumentar sus ventas ofreciéndolos a un buen precio y así percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Roxana is 29 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the village of Pedregal Bajo, a rural area in the town of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in Piura region, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Roxana raises and sells sheep, which are kept in an area near her home. When the animals have reached the right level of development, she offers them for sale to the general public and to traders who visit the area. The income she earns is used to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with whatever they need.

Roxana wants to expand her business by purchasing balanced animal feed for her sheep so that she can offer the animals at a good price, thereby increasing the income she generates. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase balanced animal feed for her sheep

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño se encuentra en su segundo  ciclo.
La Sra. Rosa S. se dedica a vender kits (paquestes) de limpieza doméstica en su casa además de enseñar en horas de la mañana en la escuelita de su barrio.
Ella desea progresar y por ello se unió a este grupo a fin de recibir un crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya mediante el equipo de KIVA.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) Committee is in its second loan cycle.

Sra. Rosa S. sells house cleaning kits from her home. In addition, she teaches at the neighborhood school in the mornings. She wants to progress, so she joined this group so that she could receive a loan from Fundación Paraguaya through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase powdered laundry soap, clothes brushes, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Hilda Margot

texts.es:
Hilda es una madre D. familia D. 44 años D. edad; ella que resiD. junto a su esposo e hijos en el caserío Vallecito ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Hilda se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donD. resiD.. Su esposo  trabaja como peón agrícola en los diversos campos D. cultivo D. la zona. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben sacan adelante a su familia.

Ella desea incrementar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado; D.  esta manera percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es  poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 44 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the village of Vallecito in the District of TambogranD.. This agricultural district is situated in Piura Province, which is in the region of the same name. The community is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Hilda raises small animals, especially sheep, in a corral located near her home. She feeds the animals grains and natural grasses. Once they have reached the proper level of development, she offers the animals for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where she lives. Her husband works as a field laborer in different farms in the area. Hilda’s family is able to get ahead because of the income both of them earn.

She wants to increase her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed so that she can generate better earnings. For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN to help her achieve her goal.

Hilda is an earnest hardworking individual. Her greatest wish is to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Acquire more animals & balanced feed

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
A. JEAN PIERRE
Commerçant de 53 ans, père de 4 enfants de 9 à 28 ans célibataire s'est lance dans la fourniture scolaire et divers il ya 17 ans, avec 35000 de capital. Ses ventes sont de 25000 à 35000 frs par jour. 
Pour sa stratégie il se lève de bonne heure et se rend au marché pour accueillir les premiers clients ainsi que avoir une diversité des marchandises. 
Avec ce prêt qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de cahiers, de livres, ardoise, crayons de couleurs, bic , sac, calculatrice. Son ambition est d'avoir une boutique de fournitures scolaires et se marier ainsi de bien scolariser son enfant. Dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre Akambina, a merchant, is a 53-year-old single father of four children ranging in age from 9 to 28 years old. He started selling school supplies and various other items 17 years ago with a capital of 35,000 francs. His sales average 25,000 to 35,000 francs per day.

His strategy is to get up early to go to the market and welcome his first customers, and to offer a variety of goods.

With this loan, he plans to buy boxes of notebooks, books, writing slates, crayons, pens, bags, and calculators. His goals are to open a school supplies store, get married, and provide his children with a good education. Everyone knows him in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy reams of paper, boxes of pens, writing slates, boxes of books

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo, es cliente antiguo de la institución y muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, el tiene un taller de balatas y frenos, ya que esa es su especialidad, en el negocio le colabora su esposa quien tiene la venta de lubricantes, ellos tienen dos hijas que se encuentran en colegio, los créditos que sacaron de emprender fueron para aumento de capital,  ellos incrementaron su capital y bienes del hogar, lograron construir su vivienda propia, es una pareja muy trabajadora, mejoraron su negocio y su calidad de vida, todos los créditos fueron créditos kiva, con el dinero del crédito compraran repuestos de movilidad y compra de lubricantes en cantidad, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is a longtime client of Emprender who is very punctual with his payments. He has a repair shop where he installs brakes and pads, which is his specialty. At his business, he and his wife work together selling lubricants. They have two daughters who are in high school. Wilfredo has taken out loans with Emprender in order to increase his capital, which enabled him to buy household goods and build his house. His wife is a hard worker who strives to improve their business and their quality of life.

All of their loans have been through Kiva and the money was used to buy automobile parts and lubricants in quantity. Wilfredo is very grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase automobile lubricants

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 50  años de edad, es viudo y reside junto a sus dos hijos  en el centro poblado menor La Estancia, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial conocida como la capital del limón; que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de cuatro años. Él siembra maracuyá en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, posteriormente comercializa su cosecha ofreciendo un producto de calidad y al mejor precio.

Clemente desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maracuyá, él espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Clemente es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Clemente is a 50 year old widower living with his two children in the small settlement of La Estancia located in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a bit of commercial activity known as the lemon capital, located in Lambayeque province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For over four years he’s been involved in farming related activities.  He plants passion fruit on a small plot of farm land he has.  He then sells his crops offering quality products at the best price.

Clemente wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his passion fruit crop.  He hopes to get a good harvest.  Because of this he has needed to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Clemente is quite a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and to get ahead.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizers and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Maclovia

texts.es: La Sra. Maclovia  tiene como actividad la venta de comida en su pensión que atiende todos los dias, esta actividad se constituye en su principal fuente de ingreso para su familia que esta compuesta por su esposo, su hija y ella,  el esposo ayuda para el mantenimiento de su hogar pero el trabaja en una provincia cercana al departamento de La Paz, en esta ocasión la sra. maclovia solicita el crédito para iniciar una actividad paralela que será la apertura de una pequeña librería la cual atenderá su hija; es una familia muy trabajadora y muy dinámica este nuevo emprendimiento ayuda a generar nuevos ingresos para el beneficio de ellos.
texts.en:
Maclovia sells prepared food in her eatery daily.  This is her family’s main source of income.  Her family is composed of her husband, her daughter and herself.  Her husband helps support the household but he works in a province near La Paz department.

On this occasion, Maclovia is asking for a loan to start a parallel business that her daughter will run: a small bookstore.

This is a very hard working, dynamic family.  This new enterprise will generate new income for the benefit of them all.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to start a parallel activity.

loans.name: Esther Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Esther tiene como actividad la elaboración D. cotillones como ser gorritos, canastitas, tarjetas, recuerdos y otros todos ellos trabajados en goma Eva, esta actividad se constituye en un apoyo para el ingreso D. su familia  que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus pequeños hijos, la Sra. es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora en esta ocasión solicita crédito para la compra D. materiales y materia prima para así poder ampliar su actividad y también para la compra D. una maquina D. costura para mejorar su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Esther’s activity is manufacturing party supplies like little hats, little baskets, greeting cards, keepsakes and others out of Eva foam.  This activity helps support contribute to family income.  The family is maD. up of her husband and small children.  

She is a dynamic, hard working person who is asking for a loan on this occasion to buy raw materials to expand her activity and also to buy a sewing machine to improve her work thus having an improved quality of life.  She is a hard working, responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres  Talentosas” cumple actualmente su 5º ciclo y se formó gracias al espíritu emprendedor que las mueve para cada jornada laboral, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa,  utilizan su crédito para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya están realizando como ser: compra de artículos de ocasión como ropas, zapatillas, championes, calzados deportivos ,kepis, gorras, etc.
La sra. María D. por ejemplo compra y vende ropas dentro de su barrio y alrededores para poder provver un ingreso económico a su familia de modo que vivan dignamente.
Todas las integrantes redoblan esfuerzos tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena preparación académica y por consiguiente una buena opción laboral.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) communal bank is currently in its 5th cycle.  It was formed thanks to the enterprising spirit that motivates them each working day.  Its members are already involved in a productive activity so each one is developing in her own micro business.  They use their loan to foster and vary the activity they are already carrying out such as: purchase of seasonal items like clothes, sandals, athletic shoes, footwear, sportswear, caps, hats, etc.

Mrs. María D., for example, buys and sells clothes in her neighborhood and adjacent areas to provide income for her family so that they can live properly.

All the members double their efforts in an attempt to improve their income and offer their children the possibility of accessing a good academic preparation and thus good employment options.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, jeans, caps, shorts, Capri pants, scarves, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Âgée de 46ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant de 15ans ,Elle est dans la vente des chaussures et vêtements  pour enfants depuis 1993 avec un capital de 18500f, elle a rembourse et a fait des épargnes durant le premier cycle de son prêt 
Le second prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock de sa marchandise en achetant les vêtements et chaussures pour enfants te que  les baskets, baby boots pour fillettes et garçons, les bottes, sandales pour garçons et filles. 
Le choix dans la qualité de marchandises, la recherche des articles à la mode sont ses stratégies de vente. 
Elle veut générer beaucoup de bénéfices et devenir importateur afin  ouvrir une boutique de ventes des chaussures pour enfants. Dans son milieu de vie, elle est considérer comme une femme courageuse parce qu’elle améliore et s’occupe de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
This woman is a 46-year-old single mother of a child age 15. She has been selling children’s shoes and clothing since 1993, starting with a capital of 18,500 francs. Her first loan, which was fully refunded, allowed her to save. 

This second loan will allow her to increase her stocks by buying children’s clothes and shoes such as sneakers, baby booties, boots, and sandals for boys and girls. Her sales strategy is focused on the quality of her merchandise, and offering trendy items. 

She wants to bolster her profits and become an importer in order to open a children's shoe store. In her circle, she is seen as a brave woman for improving her child’s lifestyle and education.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes, dresses, smocks, shoes, baby booties, and sneakers

loans.name: Efrain Miguel

texts.es: Efrain Miguel, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, es ayudante de albañil y cuando no tiene trabajo de albañileria, se dedica a tejer ropa típica de la localidad, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, cruzo el segundo grado de primaria en la escuela de su comunidad, solicita su primer crédito en ASDIR para sufragar gastos de matrimonio, en su comunidad es conocido como un joven responsable y participativo.
texts.en: Efrain is 24 years old and single. He works as a bricklayer's assistant, and when he is not doing this he knits clothing that is typical in his region. He has five years of experience and attended school through the second grade. He is requesting his first loan from the Asociacion ASDIR to pay for his wedding expenses. In his community he is known as a responsible and lively young man.

loans.use: Wedding Celebration Expenses

loans.name: Pamela Lizbeth

texts.es: La Sra. Pamela vive en la Urbanización del Recreo  de la zona del Plan 3000,  Ella tiene 20 años y tiene su tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su mamá donde ella vive, con su tienda sustenta sus estudios  ya que en las noches ella estudia enfermería, ella ayuda con los gastos de su casa ya que es soltera y no tiene hijos todavía, ella es una persona muy responsable y esta vez esta solicitando el crédito para incrementar la venta de abarrotes, (aceites, harina, arroz, azúcar,  otros) ya que donde ella vive es una zona alejada de los mercados por lo que se ve en la necesidad de surtir su venta. Ella realiza sus compras para su venta en el mercado de la Rotonda del Plan 3000.   Anteriormente ella trabajo con créditos individuales en los que demostró mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad en el crédito.
texts.en:
Pamela lives in the El Recreo housing development in Plan 3000 district.  She is 20 years old, and she has a grocery store in her mother’s house, which is where she lives.  Her store supports her studies because she is studying nursing in the evenings.  She helps with the household expenses.  She is single and does not yet have children.  She is a very responsible person.

This time she is requesting a loan to increase her grocery sales (oil, flour, rice, sugar, and others).  The area where she lives is far away from the markets.  Therefore, she needs to stock her store.  She makes her purchases for later sale at the Rotonda market in Plan 3000.

She previously worked with individual loans, and she demonstrated much responsibility and punctuality with the loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries (oil, rice, flour, sugar, and others)

loans.name: El Trebol Magico Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama EL TRÉBOL MÁGICO, porque las integrantes dicen que el trébol es una hierba de tamaño pequeño y según las creencias trae buena suerte, al que lo posee le proporciona un poder especial: suerte en el comercio, en el amor y en la riqueza. ¡Suerte ilimitada!. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, la señora  Angélica C. L. tiene 22 años de edad  y se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace tres años, no tiene hijos, y su crédito lo solicitó para la compra de maíz y un comal para incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
This group is called “EL TRÉBOL MÁGICO” (The Magic Clover) because the members say that clover is a small herb that people believe brings good luck; whoever possesses it acquires special powers: luck in commerce, in love and in wealth.  Unlimited Luck!  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo.  

Mrs. Angélica C. L., 22, has been a tortilla merchant for the past three years.  She does not have any children.  She asked for her loan to buy corn and a griddle to increase production.

loans.use: To buy corn and a griddle.

loans.name: Jose Juan De Dios

texts.es: El sr. José, vive la zona de villa obrajes, es una casa donde el y su familia  viven como cuidadores  ya que los dueños vienen solo  cada dos veces al mes , tiene una niña que esta en la escuela es su mejor inspiración y fuerza para trabajar por su familia , el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de la linea de minibuses  de sacaba trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia , el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una radio de frecuencia para taxi mantenimiento y tapizado de asientos de su movilidad, tiene un auto donde lo hará trabajar con un chofer , su sueño de don José es juntar dinero para la compra de un terreno y así tener su propia casa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José lives in the Villa Obrajes zone in a house that he and his family act as caretakers for since the owners only come by twice a month.  He has a daughter in school and she’s his greatest inspiration and strength to work for his family.

José is very well known for his work as a public transportation service provider in the Sacaba minibus line.  He works Monday through Saturday and spends Sundays with his family.

The loan will be used to buy a radio with taxi frequencies, for vehicle maintenance and to upholster the vehicle’s seats.  He owns a car that he will put to work with a driver.

José’s dream is to save up money to buy a lot to build his own house.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and to upholster the seats.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Héctor Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de soldadura. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ya que tiene que buscar lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia. El es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de realizar su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están satisfechos por el buen servicio que ofrece. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como soldadora, bomba desoldadora, guantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Héctor Antonio is a welder. He’s been in this business for over four years because he has to seek what’s necessary to support his family.  He is a very enterprising person who enjoys running his business.  Most of his customers are always satisfied with the work he does.  

The reason for the loan request is to buy raw materials like a soldering machine, a soldering pump and gloves, among others.

loans.use: To buy soldering equipment.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kossivi  est marié et a 26 ans. Il fait le commerce  de produits d’alimentation générale. Il a commencé en 2006 cette activité et s’approvisionne au grand de Lomé. Il revend les produits dans un marché local de hedzranawoé  et  est dans son deuxième cycle de prêt. Il  demande un crédit  pour acheter 5 boites de tomates, 4 cartons de sucre et 10 sacs de riz.
texts.en: Mr. Kossivi is 26 years old and married. He is in business selling groceries. He has launched his business in 2006 and stocks up at the big [market] of Lomé. He resells his products at the local market of Hedzranawoé and is now on his second loan cycle. He is seeking a loan in order to buy five cartons of tomatoes, four cartons of sugar and 10 bags of rice.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 42 años de edad , es casada, cuenta con una familia de dos hijos y una hija, ella es una madre luchadora ya que ha salido adelante con sus hijos  , y   esta solicitando su primer credito en asociacion ASDIR, para  comprar  un terreno, ya que ella es una persona responsable y desea lo mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa is 42 years old, married, and has a family consisting of two sons and a daughter.  She is a tenacious mother who has known how to get ahead with her children.

She is asking for her first loan from Asociación ASDIR to buy a lot since she’s a responsible person who wants the best for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a lot.

loans.name: Macuitxochitl Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Macuitlxochitl. Que en el dialecto nahuatl el cual todavia se habla en esa zona significa: cinco flores). Y es el nombre del boulevard que esta en la entrada a dicha comunidad. Esta ubicado en Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por diez integrantes. Esta foto fue tomada en la pequeña tienda de la señora Juliana A. P. quien es integrante del grupo. Tiene 46 años de edad no tiene estudios ni tampoco dependientes economicos, vive unicamente con su esposo, se a dedicado al comercio de frutas, verduras y abarrotes. Negocio que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita este prestamo para compra de mercancia. Sus clientes la prefieren por que los atiende amablemente y ahí encuentran lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos, también encuentran las frutas y verduras frescas a muy buen precio. Ella se siente muy contenta y comprometida ya que con este crédito va a poder invertir en su negocio para poder obtener más ingreso y así mismo más clientes y una mejor calidad de vida. Oservaciones, la señora que no se alcanza a ver bien se llama Maria Antonia V. M.
texts.en:
This group is called Macuitlxochitl which in Nahuatl, which is still spoken in this area, means Five Flowers.  That’s the name of the boulevard that’s at the entrance of said community.  It is located in the state of Puebla, México.   The group has 10 members and the photo was taken in member Juliana A. P.’s small store.

She is 46 years old and has neither formal schooling nor any economic dependents.  She lives just with her husband.  She went into fruit, vegetable and grocery sales, a business she started 10 years ago.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise.  Her customers prefer her because she caters to them kindly and they find what they need to prepare their meals there.  They also find fresh fruit and vegetables at a very good price.

She feels happy and committed because the loan will allow her to invest in her business to obtain more income as well as more customers and a better quality of life.

(Observation:  the woman who can’t be made out too well is called María Antonia V. M.)

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maryuri De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maryuri De Los Ángeles tiene 23 años, por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que con mucho sacrificio asiste a un colegio público y recibe la educación necesaria. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 que se dedica a este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que es un negocio ambulante, que nació por su familia ya que su Mama era la que se encargaba de administrar el negocio, pero con el tiempo fue que ella decidió hacerse cargo de este medio de vida. La metodología que Maria utiliza es brindar los productos de ropa a personas que trabajan en instituciones, colegios, tiendas entre otros y así recoger el dinero el día de pago. El sueño de ella es mantener su negocio y lograr obtener más recursos para invertir su inventario y también proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda
texts.en: Maryuri De Los Ángeles is 23 years old.  She has a dependent child, and with a lot of sacrifice she is able to have that child attend public school and receive an education.  Maryuri has a business selling clothing.  She has had this business for more than 6 years, but it is important to point out that it is a door-to-door business that was started by her family, since her mother was in charge of managing the business.  But over time, Maryuri decided to take over the business.  The sales method that Maria uses is to provide clothing products to people who work in institutions, schools, stores and other places and then collect the money on paydays.  She hopes to maintain her business and get more resources to invest in inventory, and also to make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Malick B. est un célibataire sans enfant age de 29ans c est un soudeur mécanicien de profession Il vend précisément des baguettes pièces pour meules scie à métaux il n'a pas de problèmes d'écoulement car ses marchandises sont utilisées dans son atelier par son patron. Ce prêt est destiné à renforcer son activité commerciale avec l'acquisition d'accessoires  et d'autres marchandises destinées à la soudure mécanique
texts.en:
Malick B. is 29 years old. He is single and has no children. A welder by profession, he sells rods, parts for grinding wheels, and metal saws. He doesn't have any distribution problems because his merchandise is used in his workshop, by his boss. 

The loan will be used to increase his business activity by purchasing accessories and other merchandise used for mechanical welding.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: Paula Argentina tiene 24 años. La actividad económica es la venta de carnes. Hace más de 8 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera de vender al por mayor lo que ofrece. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital,  y con fondos propios pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, hasta que se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar carne de res, cerdo, pollo, pelibuey entre otras. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Paula Argentina, 24, sells meat.  She’s been in this business for over 8 years now.  She sells in an ambulatory manner since this is the only way to sell what she offers at wholesale.

She started out at the beginning with very little capital using her own funds but with a strong desire to get ahead.  Gradually she increased her inventory with the few profits the business generated until she got the opportunity to work with Fundación León 2000.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy beef, pork, chicken and lamb.  Her greatest wish is to continue living to stay in business.

loans.use: To buy meats.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Eduardo; el tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor del nivel universitario y también se dedica en sus tiempos libres a la agricultura, el es propietario de un terreno donde cultiva papa, maíz y verduras y luego los vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para construir su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jorge Eduardo, 47, is a member of the “SEÑOR PASION” (Passion Lord) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is married and has three children.  He alternates his daily chores working as a University Professor.  During his free time he farms.  He owns a plot of land where he grows potatoes, corn and vegetables which he then sells independently. 

He wants to build a house and is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to do so.

He is happy because of the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy building materialsl and supplies to build his house.

loans.name: Los Gira Soles Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Girasoles" porque ya que en la zona que viven se dedican al cultivo de flor, entre ellos de girasoles. Esta ubicado al sur del Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes. La señora Angelica Díaz M. es una itegrante del grupo. Tiene 21 años, es foricultura y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Ella se dedica al cultivo de rosa que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar fumigo y fertilizante, para poder tener rosas de calidad. Sus clientes dicen que las flores que vende son de variedad y de muy buena calidad, ya que puede ser utilizada para arreglos florales o para ser utilizada en el hogar. Al solicitar este prestamo ella se siente contenta y con un apoyo extra de su familia, para poder crecer económicamente y poderle ofrecer a su hijo educación y una mejor casa. Le gustaría seguir teniendo el apoyo de los prestamos para siguir produciendo rosas y ser conocida en otros estados y paises.
texts.en: This group is called "Girasoles" (Sunflowers) because flowers are cultivated in the area where they live, among them the sunflowers.  This group is located in the south of the state of Mexico.  The group has 8 members.  Angelica Díaz M. is one of the members.  She is 21 years old, works in floriculture, and has a 4 year-old child.  She has been growing roses for 5 years.  She requests a loan to buy insecticide sprays and fertilizers, so that she can have good quality roses.  Her customers say that the variety of flowers that she sells are very high quality, and so can be used for floral arrangements or for home use.  In requesting this loan she feels very pleased, since with the extra support of her family, she will be able to grow economically and offer her child an education and a better house.  She would like to continue to have the support of the loans so that she can continue to produce roses and become known in other states and countries.

loans.use: to buy insecticide sprays and fertilizers for the cultivation of roses

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Meet some of the teachers from The SLC (Sierra Leone Church) Primary School, situated in Blama, near Kenema city. SLC Primary School, Blama.  It was built in 1902 by the Anglican Mission.  One of the oldest schools in the region, the school is staffed with five teachers and has an enrollment of 315 pupils.  This is the first loan that teachers of SLC primary school are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these teachers’ standard of living will certainly improve. 

Elizabeth C. is the leader of this group of teachers.  She is age forty-eight.  She was born in Blama, a village near Kenema city.  She is married to a police officer and the couple has five children – three are already grown-ups, one is in primary school and the other in secondary school.  Elizabeth has been a teacher for twenty-seven years now.  Elizabeth will use her share of this loan to buy house building materials such as bags of cement.

loans.use: To buy house building materials such as bags of cement.

loans.name: Mah

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Mah H. is married and has four children.  She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE.  Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their school fees so that they can be educated. 

She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital, which could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs and the family's.  With this loan, she plans to buy piglets and feed.  This investment will help people in her community to have pork.  She is planning on using the profits generated to sponsor her children in school.  She also wants to buy fowls which will provide the community with chicken. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se encuentra en su tercer ciclo.
La Sra. Juliana P. con 50 años de edad, tiene una despensa y hace sus compras en el Mercado Municipal Nro.4, sale de su casa bien temprano para realizar sus actividades y poder proveer a sus clientes todos los productos necesarios.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado, pero con mucha ganas de superación.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is currently in its third round.
Sra. Juliana P., 50 years old, has a storeroom and she does her shopping in the Municipal Market No4. She leaves the house very early to work, providing her clients with all their necessary goods. She is a resilient woman whose daily life is very hard, but she is also keen to overcome it all.

loans.use: To buy paper bags and polyethylene bags, coal, fruit and vegetables, cleaning products etc

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Matar F. est âgé de 24 ans il est marié c'est un cocher de charrette il mène en même temps des activités commerciales plus précisément le commerce de produits céréaliers il s'approvisionne depuis le bassin arachidier (kaolack) où il achète du mil et de l'arachide en grande quantité qu'il achemine à mbour pour le revendre en détail c'est un secteur qu'il maitrise très bien car n'ayant jamais connu de problèmes d'écoulement car les produits qu'il vend sont très prisés par la population
texts.en: Matar F. is 24 years old and married. He drives a horse cart. In addition, he is engaged in business activities, more specifically selling cereals. He stocks up in the peanut-growing valley (Kaolack), where he purchases large quantities of millet and peanuts and brings them to Mbour for retailing. He knows this business very well and ever had problems moving his stock as the products he sells are very popular with the local population.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: Njweng

texts.en:
R. was born in 1978, and she is married to Nkwenti Simon. They are blessed with four children and they are living in Nitop - 4, an area in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon

R. has faced some major challenges in her life: illness, poverty,  and especially that she never had the opportunity to attend school. The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business and  paying for her children’s education.  She plans to invest this loan in poultry, piggery and firewood businesses. With the production of chickens and firewood, she will be able to raise a lot of profit because they are highly demanded in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and has experience as far as this field is concerned. 

She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least good chicken for their meals, and in the North West region of Cameroon, chickens are valued and used to carry out traditional rites. So the business will be sustainable. And also, she will provide her community with good firewood which they will use as a fuel for cooking.

R. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees and save for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: firewood, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Mercedes Matilde tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa usada. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues han sido beneficiosos para ella. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, Mercedes tiene 1 hija de menor de edad a su cargo, siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisas, entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Mercedes Matilde, 44, sells used clothing.  This isn’t her first loan request since they have been very beneficial for her.  She’s had the business for over 8 years.  Mercedes has a minor daughter in her care.  She is always seeking ways to improve her family’s living conditions.  This loan will be to buy pants, skirts and shirts among other products requested.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, shirts, etc.
